204987.text: As an idol, you need clothes that match your identity! Don't be shy—pick out your favorite ones.

204990.text: I had my eyes on this one first! Let go!

204991.text: What? That's nonsense! This is MY dress! You should be the one letting go!

204992.text: A dress of such beauty should only be worn by someone with perfect proportions—namely, ME. A shorty like you should just get out of the way!

204993.text: An ape like you—putting on a fancy dress and playing princess? Don't be ridiculous!

204995.text: Alright alright, stop fighting if you wanna be the radiant maiden, ladies.

204999.text: Alright everyone listen up! You argue again, you get eliminated! You understand?

205000.text: Everyone seems to be taking a liking to the same clothes. How'd they be distributed...?

205001.text: You wanna shine? Then you gotta be strong! At the training grounds, there are magical creatures used by the Magical Guards for practice. The team to defeat them first, gets first dibs on the clothes!

205003.text: For those sweet clothes? Yep, I'm more ready than ever.

205005.text: Aaaaand that's it! The fastest one is $heroine$'s unit! They get to pick the clothes they like first.

205006.text: Yay! I'm going to pick something I've never seen before!

205007.text: That dress is so nice... I want to try it on.

205012.text: You are brighter than the sun!

205017.text: Look at that girl! Over there!

205018.text: She's so cute! Oh, what do we do! Compared to her, we're nothing! We can't win!

205019.text: Ack! Please don't come so close...

205020.text: Incredible! Your clothes fit quite well, as if they had been tailor-made for you!

205021.text: Can you tell me your name? Can we be friends?

205022.text: Um... I'm Caledonia and I'm from Elf Lakeside...

205023.text: Elf Lakeside! Are you a High Elf too?

205024.text: It's my first time meeting such a beautiful girl! I'm moved by your beauty, even as a girl!

205025.text: Oh, hehe, I'm not an Elf...

205026.text: Great! Caledonia can talk normally with others now. She's ready to take the final stage with me!

205028.text: Stamina training's on the menu today. You'll be getting your endurance up! On the stage, only those that can endure will get the last laugh.

205029.text: I don't think endurance has anything to do with stage performance...

205030.text: Exercise, again? I'm falling apart already...

205031.text: Stop whining. You're all gonna be running 5,000 meters today!

205035.text: Those things there... Are they magical creatures?

205036.text: Don't even think of slacking off. These magical creatures will be hot on your trail. Try going slow, and you'll become magical chow!

205038.text: Flora, come on! They're catching up!

205039.text: I... can't... My legs feel like they're made of lead... Huff... Can't run anymore... Eurgh...

205042.text: I'm sorry, it's my fault. I'm dragging everyone down...

205043.text: You're paler than a ghost. Better rest for a while.

205044.text: You over there, stop slacking off! Your unit is running last! Run, run, run!

205046.text: Idols must have a remarkable stage presence! You need to spark excitement in the audience through your own enthusiasm. Where you look, how you move—they're all vital. So, today, your training is about—controlling your expression!

205048.text: Something like, keeping a smile up at the audience all the time?

205049.text: That's called being a clown, not an idol!

205050.text: I want you all to practice how to put on different expressions naturally. You have to convey your feelings to the audience when you are on the stage! Let's try a smiling practice first.

205057.text: Too stiff. That's worse than crying.

205059.text: How naive! You smile like that, you get boos! Looks like I'll have to use my magic to fix your facial muscles in place.

205060.text: Next is putting on a troubled face that makes people go "awww."

205061.text: I mean, that's not really a helpful description...

205062.text: Yeah! I haven't a clue as well!

205063.text: You leave me no choice then. It's magic puppet time! Do your best to run away from them if you don't wanna be mowed down!

205065.text: Yes! That's it. That's the face that makes people go "awww!" Keep that look! The magic puppets are going to catch up!

205066.text: Excellent. That was perfect. Everyone, remember this feeling. Let's take a break for five minutes, then go on with the rest of the training. Flora, you stay here and keep practicing that smile.

205067.text: And so, poor Flora keeps practicing her smile for a long time.

205068.text: Can we finally take a break now?

205071.text: Um... My smile... Is it really that odd?

205072.text: Tomorrow is the mid-point showcase. Half of you are going buh-bye! Today, you will practice freely as a unit to prepare for tomorrow's performance.

205073.text: Will there be a big crowd coming tomorrow?

205074.text: There shouldn't be an audience, just the judges.

205075.text: Only judges? But they're still strangers, huh...

205076.text: Hey, that unit over there, you want a go at a mock performance?

205078.text: The stage there is the one that will be used tomorrow, and now the kids from around here are sitting in the audience. You can perform for them as practice for tomorrow.

205079.text: I see. Okay then! Please, Miss Dorin, let us practice!

205080.text: Quite a few units want a go at performance practice. Guess it's magic puppet time again! Only the unit that beats the puppets gets stage time today!

205081.text: So this is the stage for tomorrow? Wow, so many people below!

205082.text: Just a dozen kids, but I'm still going to do my best!

205084.text: Are you okay? You don't look so good.

205085.text: I'm fine, I... I will try my best.

205087.text: I am Caledonia, from Elf Lakeside. Hello to you all!

205088.text: I'm Ardisia! My hometown is far away by the sea. I hope my singing reaches your heart!

205093.text: Louder, miss! I can't hear you!

205094.text: You're too soft! I can't hear you! Are you blushing? Singers aren't for blushers! Singers aren't for blushers!

205095.text: Haha! Blusher, blusher! Get off the stage!

205098.text: Fighting back tears, Flora runs off the stage.

205101.text: There you are. Finally found you.

205102.text: Sorry, I messed up the mock performance, and it's all my fault. I'm sorry, everyone...

205103.text: There's no need to apologize. We don't blame you. Caledonia and Ardisia are worried about you too.

205104.text: I guess I'm still... afraid of strangers...

205107.text: Let her lean on your shoulder

205110.text: Your necklace? Hah yeah, I know where it is. Look up, it's over there! Up on that tree!

205111.text: Ha! Looks like you'll have to jump higher. Haha! You can't reach it!

205112.text: (Sniffs) Give it back! Please... It was my mother's...

205114.text: I think... we should return the necklace to her. She's all by herself already. It's so sad.

205115.text: Huh? Return the necklace to her? To this little monster? Didn't your mother tell you not to go near the forest due to those dangerous monsters?

205116.text: Yeah, yeah! She is from the forest. She must be a little monster!

205117.text: What? She's a monster... That's awful!

205118.text: Give it back, please, give it back to me...

205119.text: Alright, whatever. Let's ignore this little monster and play hide-and-seek instead!

205120.text: Ya better hide well! Prepare for punishment when I catch you!

205121.text: Losing isn't enough? There's punishment too?

205122.text: Let me see... Oh, I've got it! If you lose, you have to sit next to the little monster!

205123.text: What? No! It's so gloomy around her, especially when I have known she's a monster...

205125.text: You little pricks! How dare you bully Lady Flora!

205128.text: Lady Flora, please don't cry. Here's Lady Dana's necklace. Do put it on.

205130.text: I knew it. Strangers should be forbidden to come near the forest. The outside world is too dangerous for you, Lady Flora.

205131.text: If you're afraid, you don't have to force yourself. I'll help you explain to the others. You can return to...

205132.text: Argh...! Stop it! What do you know about me?!

205133.text: "The outside world is scary!" "Don't go out of the forest!" "Don't force yourself!" I have been always told these and I even know what you're saying next! "You can return to the forest first." Right?

205134.text: All these words... I'm sick of hearing them!

205135.text: Flora suddenly lets out a flood of complaints, as if something took over her. I can only stay silent in the face of her deluge of words.

205136.text: I don't want to be protected any more—I want to protect others, like what my mother did... I want to get out of the forest, meet new friends, help my brethren, do my best to save the forest...

205137.text: ...Sorry. I shouldn't have snapped at you. It's all my fault for being weak...

205143.text: But I'm no good with strangers. I only have Caledonia as my friend.

205149.text: Did you not notice? You've already been talking to me on such close terms. A stranger—me—has become your friend. Do you still think I'm scary?

205154.text: Welcome, participants! It's finally time for the mid-point showcase. As you can see, my latest research stands at the entrance. Defeat this magic puppet, and you'll get to perform on stage.

205155.text: After the mid-point show, half of the units will be eliminated. Want to be the most dazzling girl? Then defeat the puppet for stage entry!

205156.text: Finally, it's time for the mid-point show. There are so many people in the audience! Are they the judges over there?

205157.text: Flora, why are you dressed like your usual self?

205158.text: I'm not qualified to be an idol yet. I'll leave my idol clothes for the final performance.

205159.text: Just chill out! We will take care of the first half of the song, and you can handle the solo at the end.

205161.text: Don't look at the audience, and you won't be so scared. Just do as we practiced.

205162.text: We're the next ones up. Oof, I'm so nervous!

205165.text: My daughter, you, singing for the Humans...?

205167.text: Flora, what's wrong? You don't look so good.

205168.text: It's nothing, just a bit nervous.

205170.text: You're really pale. Do you need some water?

205171.text: I'm fine. It's time for our entry.

205172.text: It's finally our turn! Let's go!

205173.text: Caledonia and Ardisia weave together a spectacular performance in the first half of the song, so if this keeps up, we'll definitely make it to the finals. And now, it is time for Flora's solo.

205174.text: Despicable Humans... How dare they lie to me...$B$Contemptible beings... How dare they...

205176.text: The music plays on, but Flora is standing still with her mouth open like a statue, not a sound coming out of her.

205177.text: (Softly) Flora, it's your turn. Hurry up and sing...

205179.text: Humans, they're repugnant. My daughter, promise eternal hatred for them.

205180.text: (Softly) No choice, then. I'll have to sing instead.

205181.text: Caledonia picks up and sings the rest of the song, ending the performance to the judges' bewilderment. Yet, Flora stays silent from the beginning to the end with her mouth agape, petrified on the stage.

205183.text: Flora runs off the stage and straight out of the venue. It is my second time seeing her cry.

205184.text: I don't know how long it took me, but I finally catch up to Flora at the lake.

205185.text: You ran for so long... I didn't expect you have such endurance...

205187.text: Because I'm worried about you, of course.

205188.text: I'm sorry. It's because of me that everyone's performance was...

205189.text: The performance? You don't have to apologize for that. We passed and we're going on to the next round.

205191.text: Half the groups failed in combat and were eliminated. That's why we still make it to the finale even though we got zero points for the mid-point performance.

205193.text: Why do you keep apologizing? Take it slow and try to engage with strangers. I'm sure you can...

205195.text: You're giving up without even trying...

205196.text: It's no use. I'm not afraid of strangers—I realized. How else could we have become friends otherwise?

205197.text: When I stood on the stage, I heard that voice again.

205199.text: The voice from beyond. My mother's voice...

205200.text: It reminds me that I hate Humans... With the Elven blood coursing through my body, I could never ever get on well with Humans. I shall always hold a grudge against Humans. Then how can I sing for them...?

205201.text: I won't cry anymore. When I was a child, I always wondered why I shouldn't come into contact with Humans. Then Mayahuel told me that I descend from the noble bloodline, and I mustn't fall into nothingness as my mother did...

205203.text: And you just hate Humans because of your mother?

205204.text: My mother is the goddess that protects this forest, and also the leader of the High Elves. But she's now sleeping at the bottom of the lake.

205205.text: Nobody would tell me about my mother. However, I've overheard people whispering behind my back about her. They said that my mother, after being deceived by Humans, finally lost her Elven powers and sank into eternal slumber with a broken heart.

205206.text: Though High Elves can live for thousands of years, much longer than Humans can, a time still comes when their lives end.

205207.text: As you may imagine, once High Elves reproduce, their magic power is passed to their offspring, which leads them to the end of their life. This is why High Elves never reproduce.

205208.text: My birth meant the death of my mother. As the leader of the Elves, she should not have broken this taboo, but she was deceived by Humans...

205209.text: Please take your hands off my head. You're messing up my hair...

205212.text: I'm starting to feel the pain and loneliness in my slumbering mother's heart...

205213.text: My mother must have been in deep regret—she must hate the Humans who deceived her. Humans have always been backstabbers. They can't defeat the monsters themselves, so they let the Floating Isles rise. With the rise of the Isles, they run out of resources, and then come for our forests.

205214.text: They've forgotten that it was the High Elves that defeated the Demongod and saved their ancestors. Now they just bite the hand that feeds them. They invade our home and cut down trees, bringing destruction to the forest.

205215.text: And look at what I'm doing—becoming an idol, singing for Humans. My mother... I heard her voice clearly. She must be wrathful at her daughter's misdeeds.

205216.text: But if I don't do these, I cannot protect this forest. Since childhood, I have been worshipped by everyone and praised for whatever I do. Then I've always pretended to be a good girl, constantly putting on a show.

205217.text: Yet when I sat by the lakeside, looking at my reflection, I could not recognize the girl in the water. Who's that girl bound by the Elven blood and donning that mask for others?

205218.text: I hope I can guard this forest instead of my mother but I did nothing—I can do nothing. The forest is in danger, and I'm powerless. All I did was throw a tantrum—pulling at my hair, and pounding at the ground.

205219.text: When I calmed down, my clothes were torn and my fingers were bleeding. It is then that I realized—the reflection, the one in the lake that I was seeing, that was the real me.

205220.text: The reflected girl's hair was a mess, even torn out in some places. Her eyes bloodshot, her fingers seething with pin-prickled pain, her lungs crushed as if underwater. But... that girl, that, was the real me. I know now that I am being the real "Flora", who will stand out and protect the forest.

205221.text: So I won't run away anymore. I will train to make up for my lack of stamina. I will do my best to complete the most intense of dance practices. I'll work hard and learn to put on makeup. Even if I may detest fighting, I will stand up to my enemies, and never run away.

205222.text: Hurray, you're back, Flora! Everyone was so worried about you!

205223.text: I'm sorry. I panicked, so I...

205224.text: Never mind. We made it through anyway—just barely though. But there's still time! We'll all help you overcome your stranger anxiety.

205225.text: $heroine$ will help too, right? For the final victory, let's all work together!

205226.text: Congratulations, idols-to-be! You've passed and you're halfway there. But next up is the main event. See that building over there? That's the training ground for all of you.

205227.text: Those magic puppets are so scary...

205228.text: Ya ain't catching the stars if you're afraid of the slightest thing! To become the most dazzling girl, you must first be able to perform for 12 hours straight. Your stamina and willpower must be paralleled by none!

205230.text: 12 hours straight? That's... impossible... Even for me...

205232.text: These floating realms all have a magic puppet on them. Defeat the puppets to obtain the rewards we prepared for you. But you better watch out! Because the realm will crumble and collapse once you leave.

205233.text: So there is no turning back?

205235.text: Every floating realm is a challenge. You'll have to keep moving forward, much like how idols meet challenge after challenge. And in the final one, the giganto magic puppet—my magical magnum opus—is waiting for you, and it's not falling easily! Defeat it and prove yourself! Only the best get on the final stage.

205236.text: Alright, everyone, get cracking! Beat the odds to become a true idol!

205237.text: Today, we have a special training session to build up your endurance. This is no normal training! Don't sign up for this if you lack the willpower to see it through!

205238.text: Sounds kinda suspicious... I'm a little scared...

205239.text: I... I... I want to take part in this training.

205240.text: Huh? Flora, you're going at it head-on...?

205242.text: Brave challengers, select an event to challenge!

205249.text: What a flimsy bag-o-bones you are, girl. You're lying flat when you've only just started?

205250.text: Nngh, I have to hold on...

205252.text: This is more tiring than riding horses. I give up...

205253.text: Flora, you're still hanging in there.

205256.text: 5 more to go, Flora! You can do it!$B$5... 4... 3... 2... 1... Finished!

205259.text: Let's call it for the training today and go soak in the hot springs, everyone!

205262.text: But today's training has just begun...

205263.text:
Alright, girls, rest time is over. Next is a strength-up special... 
What?! Where did everyone go?

205264.text: The training is draining, but it is effective for getting in shape. Dancing +100!

205265.text: Girls, get ready at the starting line.

205266.text: Already? But I haven't even warmed up yet.

205267.text: I don't need a warm-up. I'm ready always!

205270.text: My legs are feeling weak. Ow! It hurts—

205272.text: Ow! I think I've got a cramp... Oof! You guys go ahead. I'll hop over to the rest area.

205273.text: Do you need me to go with you?

205274.text: It's okay, $heroine$ can help me. You catch up with Flora. She's already ahead.

205276.text: Flora's taking the lead—Ah, ouchies! You should go and catch up with her.

205278.text: My legs are giving in... Hah... Flora, I'll leave the rest to...

205281.text: The last 100 meters! Run, everyone! The finishing line is right before your eyes!

205282.text: Just you here at the goal? Where is everyone else?

205283.text: I... I can't believe that... I made it...

205284.text: Tsk, what a bunch of wusses. They are sooo getting an extra-special training.

205285.text: You can go rest... Ah! Are you collapsing too? Hold on! I don't know any healing magic!

205286.text: Anyone, help! Someone's fainted over here! HELP!

205288.text: I don't know anything about the harp. Can I just give up?

205290.text: Sure. If you wanna give up, just go wait a while under that tree. The staff will guide you to another type of training.

205291.text: All right then, you two take your time playing the harp. I'll go take a break first!

205293.text: Hehe, little does she know, a training of 100 chin-ups await her.

205295.text: Flora, teach me how to play the harp. Pleeeaaase...

205297.text: You spent two hours and you still can't pluck a note?

205299.text: Look what we have from our honor student Flora. Pitch perfect, all this time! Simply amazing! Look at these hands! Such supple and flexile fingers, unlike yours... Wait. What's this...? Why are your fingers all swelled up?

205300.text: Um... Can you please let go of my hands?

205302.text: Sorry... My hands are all numb from playing the harp for so long...

205304.text: Flora, do you find the training grounds a little too quiet today?

205305.text: Yes, quite a few participants seem to be missing here...

205306.text: Looks like quite a number of 'em collapsed after the strength training yesterday. Is today going to be even harsher...?

205307.text: Alright, all of you aspiring dazzling diamonds! Shush...! Wait a second, why is it so quiet today? Aren't you all usually a bunch of chit-chatting chirpers?

205308.text: Um... Some are still recovering from the training yesterday, I think...

205309.text: Huh? Such a simple training has crushed them? What a bunch of lazybones... When I was crunching through magical research, I stayed up through three days and three nights! Reminds me that I was called a magical genius...

205310.text: (Clears throat) Ahem... Anyways, for those who didn't give up, what we have for you today is an important session on expression. You wanna conquer the stage? Then ya gotta get your charm through to the audience.

205311.text: Now, all of you, pick a selling point about yourself! Then an expert will tailor-make a presentation plan for you. Well then, let the training... begin!

205313.text: This is the first time I've heard of this term. What does it mean?

205314.text: It means the part of yourself you're most confident in showing others.

205315.text: Hmm, I don't think I get it still. So... "what makes me cute?"

205317.text: That's so difficult though... Because... Look! I'm cute all over...

205319.text: What will you choose as your selling point?

205320.text: Uh... I'm sorry, I don't really know either... Can you help me choose? My charm is—

205321.text: Flora is cute all over, but the smiling Flora is the best

205322.text: Flora, your fingertips look so beautiful when you're performing.

205323.text: Awww, you're exaggerating! But saying my smile is the best... that makes me feel a little undeserved.

205324.text: At first, it was only for the sake of the Forest of Elves. I went through idol training like a magic puppet... But recently, I've come to learn that becoming an idol is something to be happy about. Coming out of the forest like this, working hard with Caledonia and Ardisia, and having your support and company, all spice up my life.

205327.text: I want to study harder and learn more about idols. Everyone here is so amazing and very hard at training, Caledonia and Ardisia as well. If I don't try to catch up, I'll be left behind...

205328.text: If you have any suggestions, do tell me. I'll try my best! I know I'm not communicative, so could you stay by my side all the time...

205329.text: Oh, um, I don't mean anything strange... It's just that... everyone else is so talented, and I'm afraid I can't catch up with them.

205330.text: Caledonia has her own charms, and Ardisia has her own cuteness. Flora, you too, have your own spark.

205332.text: You've persevered up to this point. Step on the final stage and become an idol! It's no longer just for the Forest of Elves, but for your own as well. For now though, keep your feet on the ground and complete the daily training. Let's get your performance-related abilities up first.

205333.text: This way, you'll surely find something that only you, Flora, can do. This should be where your specialty lies.

205334.text: Something that only I can do... Thank you, $heroine$. I will do my best to complete the training!

205335.text: Yep, to get you to smile more, Flora, let's do our best together.

205336.text: Smiling might not be her forte, but she still does her best at showing the smile of the century to the audience. Expression +100!

205337.text: You've been looking at my hands...? And noticing my fingertips as well, wow... Well, but I don't think it's really that impressive...

205338.text: The beauty lies in the details. I saw your attentiveness from your fingertips, Flora. I think they're very beautiful.

205339.text: This is my first time hearing something like this... To tell you the truth, my hands kind of make me feel inadequate.

205340.text: It's okay, you don't need to go so far to comfort me—holding my hands like this and telling me such platitudes... You can feel it too, can't you? The obvious calluses and cracks. These hands, like myself, can't achieve anything. These scars too, can't be removed, even with magic.

205341.text: But I really like your hands a lot, Flora.

205342.text: There you go again. I bet you can't find another girl with such unsightly hands in all of Cassiel.

205343.text: I bet I can't find another girl with such beautiful hands in all of Cassiel.

205344.text: Your hands are not the result of just a few days of work. They are the proof of your daily practices since you were a child.

205345.text: You've said that you played the harp by the lake in order to resonate with your mother. You wanna become like your mother, protecting the forest, right?

205346.text: Your hands are the evidence of your hard work. Anyone who sees them, touches them, will understand. Your mother, who gave life to you, must have a similar pair of hands.

205347.text: My hands... are like my mother's hands, huh...

205348.text: The day will come when she plays her mother's melody to the audience. Expression +100!

205349.text: Impressive! You've gotten so far, everyone! Do you see the exit in front of you? Go through that exit, and you'll get to the final stage!

205350.text: This magic puppet is my proudest creation so far! You all can get ready to become my experimental data. Heehee, good magic puppet... ACTIVATE!

205352.text: We can finally show our hard work to everyone.

205353.text: We've done so much. We will surely win in the finals.

205356.text: (Costume checked. Voice in shape. GOOD! I believe I can make it!)

205357.text: Flora, don't be nervous! We'll be on soon!

205359.text: (I'm going to do my best. That voice is still ringing faintly, but I must win. I will become an idol for the sake of the Forest of Elves.)

205360.text: Caledonia and Ardisia perform splendidly for the first half of the song. Now, it is time for Flora's solo.

205361.text: (Finally... So many people below the stage... Humans, so many...)

205364.text: They deceived me, played with my feelings, and then abandoned me... Now they are making my daughter perform for them... How deep my hate runs...

205365.text: The music flows on, but Flora is standing onstage with her mouth agape, not a sound coming out of her.

205369.text: What's wrong with that girl? Why isn't she singing?

205370.text: She singing or nah? Were they all lip-syncing just now?

205373.text: Flora, you still can't let go...

205375.text: Ack! Who are you? You can't run onstage without permission! Get off! Get off the stage now!

205376.text: Shut your trap, you Human imp!

205377.text: Eek—W-who are you anyways?! Get off the stage right now!

205378.text: How dare you talk to a high elf this way?

205380.text: I'm sorry. I didn't listen to you, Mayahuel. I left the forest, and I even involved myself with Humans...

205383.text: This was left to you by Lady Dana before she fell asleep.

205384.text: This is... a painting of my mother?

205385.text: My mother is playing the harp by the lake, and there's a... a human next to her? I can't make out the features, but that's a... male human?

205387.text: Lady Dana has always hoped that you wouldn't be bound by the duties of a forest goddess like she had been.

205388.text: However, having lost Lady Dana, we could only place our hopes on you. We held to the hope that you could replace Lady Dana in guiding us and saving the Forest of Elves. We forced you to learn magic and Lady Dana's melody of life...

205389.text: Lady Dana's resentment should not be borne by you. You should have lived happily as a normal girl...

205390.text: I don't want to play the harp anymore.

205392.text: It's too boring. Everyone went swimming in the lake and had fun there. I'm the only one here practicing the harp.

205393.text: Is something the matter? You played your last piece so well!

205394.text: Playing well doesn't make me happy. It only makes you happy, Mayahuel.

205395.text: Flora, you'll become the goddess of this forest in the future. Everyone will revere you. You have to play the melody of life, like how Lady Dana did.

205396.text: But that's all so complicated... I don't see any point in it.

205397.text: Well, maybe you'll eventually understand through practice! Before you become a goddess revered by everyone, why not try practicing to find an answer?

205398.text: What kind of nonsense is that... Oh, forget it. It's useless talking to you all.

205399.text: Now... I think I finally have an answer...

205400.text: Mayahuel, my mother does not hate Humans.

205401.text: How can that be? That wretched man...

205402.text: My mother is smiling in this painting... isn't she? She must never have resented Humans, and never resented my father.

205403.text: Impossible! How do you know that? We must never forget the humiliation and pain that Lady Dana went through!

205404.text: (Holds out her hands and proudly shows the crowd the coarse hands she once loathed)

205406.text: I hated playing the harp, but as you required, I have never stopped practicing for the sake of protecting the Forest of Elves. I hated how my hands grew coarser by the day...

205407.text: Till one day, a certain someone told me that my hands were beautiful. Then I realized that I could be more like my mother if I played her melody. This is how I grew to like my hands.

205408.text: I can keep practicing the harp, because I want to play my mother's melody with my own hands, which must be able to pass on my love to my mother.

205409.text: Now I finally understand my mother. She must have missed my father a lot, and that was why she kept playing the harp by the lake. Her hands must be the same as mine. They must be hands woven by love...

205410.text: Look, Mayahuel. I was right. My mother's words are on the back of the painting:$B$"Flora, my love runs eternal for you and your father."

205412.text: The judges are letting them get on the stage again?

205414.text: Pah, they're bending under High Elf pressure, eh?

205416.text: Shh—be quiet! Don't let that elf hear you.

205418.text: Mother... Someday, I will also commit to being a mom. When I teach the melodies to my children as you did it to me, I know that tears of happiness will flow from my eyes.

205419.text: I'm glad I was able to persevere, and not give up on playing the harp. My hands, my voice... I know they must be like yours now.

205420.text: Though that magic puppet was defeated by your unit, I have attained my goal—collecting enough data for another upgrade, and... Tadah! This is my latest masterpiece. Want a go at it?

205422.text: Welcome to the singing classroom. From today on, I'll be teaching you how to sing. I hope you can improve yourself and learn to sing loudly on the final stage.

205423.text: Awesome! We get such a gentle-looking teacher teaching us!

205424.text: Well, I... I'll try my best!

205425.text: So we'll be singing? La-la-la, I LOVE singing!

205426.text: Students over there, don't open your mouth before I ask you to!

205427.text: But... Isn't this a music class? If we aren't singing, then...

205428.text: How should you answer your teacher?!

205432.text: Let's do a basic enunciation exercise. Take a deep breath and then slowly exhale from your belly. Give it a try.

205433.text: Inhale deeply and then exhale in one breath.

205434.text: Inhale gently and then exhale slowly.

205436.text: Cool. I succeeded in singing high notes by following the teacher's instructions.

205437.text: Singing training is very effective. Singing +100.

205439.text: Running out of breath midway through? Looks like we all need to up our game according to the teacher's instructions.

205440.text: Singing is indeed very difficult. Keep practicing. Singing +50.

205442.text: From today on, we're gonna do dance practice. Without further ado, just follow my beat and practice with your own body!

205444.text: My body is so stiff that it's hard for me to maintain balance...

205445.text: Students over there, stop chatting! Keep your legs up and your back straight!

205446.text: Sniff... Mom, baddies are just everywhere...

205448.text: Let's do flexibility exercises. We'll start with forward bends. Try to put your legs together, straighten your arms and try your best to bend forward. I'll record your scores on the record board.

205449.text: Ouch, it hurts... I already don't get enough exercise... My body seems to be giving out... What do I do...

205450.text: Bending this far should be good enough. I'll let the teacher check the score.

205451.text: Straighten your arms and do your best to bend forward.

205452.text: Are you trying to slack off? You can't be an idol if you don't work harder. Keep your arms straight!

205454.text: Owww... The teacher beat me with the record board...

205455.text: It's fun to bend forward. Look, I've bent forward more than 25cm!

205456.text: Great. You did a perfect job! You can move on to the next exercise. The rest of you, stop slacking off!

205457.text: Hehe, the teacher praised me! I must tell my mom the good news.

205458.text: Please check my posture. Is this good enough?

205459.text: It's passable, but you can do better. Go over there and prepare for the next exercise.

205460.text: Aww... I'm the only one left behind...

205461.text: Dance practice is hard. I'll have to start with the basics and practice carefully. Dancing +50.

205462.text: It hurts... but I think I can stretch my arms further.

205463.text: Looks like you're pretty out of shape. Try going at it little by little and do a better job tomorrow.

205464.text: Dance practice is difficult, but progress is being made. You look forward to tomorrow's practice. Dancing +100.

205466.text: I'm the teacher in charge of the makeup course. Makeup styles vary from person to person. I can only teach you the basics. You should determine your own style afterwards. Become your ideal self!

205467.text: I have no experience in doing makeup. Is it difficult?

205468.text: Makeup? Mom taught me. Let me help you.

205469.text: Are we going to be your guinea pigs?

205471.text: Today we'll practice drawing eyeshadow. Don't go too hard when you're just starting out!

205472.text: Should I just follow the teacher's instructions when I'm just starting out?

205473.text: Use a light color as base shade first.

205474.text: Sweep a thick eye shadow directly.

205475.text: Good. You're taking it seriously and doing what I said. That's it! Use a light color as base shade, then concentrate darker shadow in the eye crease, and finally add depth in the eye ends. Have a try!

205476.text: Okay. Thank you for your guidance.

205477.text: It's your first time doing makeup, but you got praised by the teacher! Expression +100.

205478.text: Put a thick eye shadow like this and then...

205479.text: Did I do it right? I feel like something's off. It doesn't feel like what the teacher said...

205481.text: I just did what Ardisia told me.

205482.text: Hey, you! What are you doing over there? Look at yourselves in the mirror!

205483.text: You failed in doing makeup for the first time, but hopefully you should make progress tomorrow. Expression +50.

205484.text: This is the recreation room used for teambuilding and relieving practice fatigue.

205486.text: Wow, so many new toys! There is even a swimming pool!

205487.text: Want to try some board games?

205489.text: Have a swimming competition with other teams.

205491.text: I didn't expect Flora to be good at this game.

205492.text: Hehe. I was just lucky! I didn't expect we'd have so much fun playing games together. I'll teach Mineer and the others how to play board games after I return to the Forest of Elves.

205493.text: Played board games together and had a good time. Cohesion +100.

205495.text: I'm sorry. I held you back again...

205496.text: Looks like you need to get in shape.

205497.text: The lack of stamina lost you the swimming competition, but you all worked hard together. Cohesion +50.

205498.text: Today, we'll practice singing harmony. Each team should practice in order.

205499.text: Flora, you need to speed up the tempo here and sing it in one breath.

205500.text: Sorry... I made a mistake again...

205501.text: Everyone is good at singing, but I'm the only one who is holding them back.

205502.text: We all have our strengths and weaknesses, and we all have different personalities. If you think you're not good enough, try working at it step by step, Flora!

205503.text: But I'd never catch up with the others this way... I'll hold them back if I'm slow...

205504.text: Then just work hard at your own pace.

205505.text: Then use your rest time for special training.

205506.text: But... I have to work harder than the others. Otherwise, I can't catch up with them...

205507.text: Everyone's pace is different. What's important is not to give up, take it easy, and work hard at your own pace. Then you'll surely be rewarded.

205508.text: Thank you... I always feel more motivated after talking with you.

205509.text: You trained more proactively and gradually found the right feeling. Singing +100.

205510.text: Do I have to do this...? Sniff... Then... to catch up with the others, I won't sleep tonight...

205511.text: You practiced during rest time but failed to achieve good results, instead, you became more tired. Singing +50.

205512.text: Today, we'll practice some fierce dance moves. Everyone, warm up and keep up with my beat!

205513.text: Finally, a break... I feel my bones are falling apart...

205514.text: Flora, let's go over there to take a rest.

205516.text: Well... I had a tough time in the dance class. I tried my best, but I still can't keep my moves consistent with the others'...

205517.text: I'd like to stay and practice with Flora.

205518.text: Discuss with and ask everyone to match Flora's moves.

205519.text: Sorry to hold you back again...

205520.text: It doesn't matter. Let's go to class together next time and practice together after class.

205521.text: Okay. Then I'll be counting on you!

205522.text: Practicing with the others greatly improved Flora's enthusiasm. Flora quickly caught up with the others. Dancing +100.

205523.text: But I'm the one holding everyone back, it isn't right getting the others to accommodate me...

205525.text: Why are you all so slow? Don't slack off and keep moving!

205527.text: Dancing is difficult, you better try harder. Dancing +50.

205528.text: Makeup will make you shine and stand out all day. Keep it in mind and try your best!

205530.text: This magazine is said to be popular lately. It advertises the chicest lip gloss.

205531.text: We don't really get what's inside, but the pictures look interesting.

205533.text: Apply a thin layer of lip gloss for succulent lips.

205534.text: Apply a thick layer of lip gloss for a mature look.

205535.text: Wow, Flora, your lips look so shiny. They're quite different from before!

205537.text: Give me the lip gloss. I want to try it, too!

205538.text: You got the hang of it and became better at makeup skills. Expression +100.

205539.text: Ah, Flora, it doesn't feel right...

205541.text: Hahaha, Flora, look at yourself in the mirror!

205542.text: You failed but learned something. Expression +50.

205543.text: Today, we'll practice the treble. Let's start with the bass and raise the tone little by little.

205545.text: How unpleasant to hear! Stop making noise!

205546.text: What? Your treble is the weird one! You don't just look like a gorilla, you even sound like one as well!

205547.text: Wanna piece of me? My treble is higher than yours, just like our height difference. Hahaha!

205548.text: Hmph, obviously mine is higher. Wanna challenge me?

205550.text: It's none of your business! You sound worse than her!

205551.text: Try me. I can sing in treble.

205552.text: Leave them alone and continue the practice.

205556.text: You pushed yourself too hard, causing your voice to sound hoarse. You got something out of it, at least... maybe? Singing +50.

205557.text: Flora, forget about them. Let's practice together.

205559.text: It's almost time for class. Stop dawdling. Get into the classroom!

205561.text: Flora, well done. Come to the front and demonstrate.

205562.text: That's great, Flora. You're the leading dancer.

205565.text: What's up, Flora? Hurry up to get changed. Let's eat together! My favorite dessert is available today.

205566.text: I can't find my shoes. I remember putting them in my locker before class...

205567.text: We've been searching for a while, but still can't find Flora's shoes.

205568.text: Did someone wear her shoes by mistake?

205569.text: Poor thing. It's no use looking for them. Your shoes were hidden by that gorilla.

205571.text: Likely because you've been an eyesore to her. She thinks you stole her thunder. Don't give me that look. Her training shoes are in the locker over there. Just fill it with sharp rocks for revenge.

205573.text: Just this time. Let her suffer a bit, too...

205574.text: Oh, you're just a goody two-shoes, aren't you? Forget it, then. Your shoes are hidden in that box over there.

205576.text: Mom said only evil people would do this kind of thing...

205578.text: All-day class ended. You feel a bit ashamed. Dancing +50.

205579.text: Today, you'll apply makeup to your partner and try to match the style to their features. This will enhance your understanding of beauty. Give it a shot!

205581.text: Why don't you want me to do your makeup?

205583.text: Flora, I got the base makeup done. You may go ahead.

205584.text: Match Caledonia with a lavish style.

205585.text: Match Caledonia with a cute and young style.

205586.text: Hmm... Doesn't this look a bit too... mature?

205587.text: It wasn't a perfect fit, but you still learned something. Expression +50.

205588.text: Well, I'll leave it to you, Flora...

205589.text: Any volunteers? I need volunteers to practice makeup...

205592.text: Everyone, get ready for today's new training.

205594.text: I've been doing a lot of stamina training lately. I feel drained the day after...

205595.text: Yeah, classes are stressful. Everyone seems to be busy and they don't have enough time for class...

205596.text: If we go on like this, can we even pass the mid-point showcase... $heroine$, is it okay to keep training like this?

205597.text: Don't worry too much. Just focus on the training daily.

205598.text: What matters is that we train together.

205599.text: Sorry... You're right. We'll make progress as long as we keep on training every day. I won't be all sulky again. Let's keep it up!

205600.text: You got refreshed and readied yourselves for today's training. Singing +50.

205601.text: To sing better, it's important to keep practicing. However, I think what's more important is to sing with everyone together.

205603.text: No matter the length of time, Flora, the time we spend singing happily with you will become the memories and motivation for us to move forward.

205604.text: Keep this in mind while we attend the daily training. Then we'll make progress and stand out on stage.

205605.text: Singing together will be our motivation... I see... Thanks! This must matter more than singing skills and talent... I will cherish the time with everyone. Let's keep it up!

205606.text: You seem to have learned something important. Singing +100.

205607.text: Alright, lazy bones. This... is... Sparta...! Dance time!

205608.text: I didn't do well again in today's dance practice... Everyone's doing all the moves perfectly, but I... never got any of them down...

205609.text: Ardisia, Caledonia, everyone else will definitely shine on stage... But me...? I don't know what to do to stand out just like them...?

205610.text: If you keep on training, you will make it.

205612.text: Sorry... You're right. We'll make progress as long as we keep on training every day. I won't be all sulky again. Let's keep it up!

205613.text: You got refreshed and readied yourselves for today's training. Dancing +50.

205615.text: Flora, you have your own spark. I want to find it with you.

205616.text: Can I shine... just like the others?

205617.text: You lacked faith in yourself, which is you want to change yourself and shine like the others, right? If you keep it up, you will make it. Let's find ways to achieve this.

205618.text: You do dance practice harder than ever. Dancing +100.

205619.text: Try to be the one you want to be today.

205620.text: Hehe, I got praised by my teacher today.

205623.text: Good job! Flora, you did it all by yourself.

205624.text: All by myself? No, it's not a one-girl-effort. Everybody has been cheering me up, especially $heroine$. That's why I worked so hard to change myself.

205625.text: So, could you please stay with me to cheer me up as always...?

205626.text: You've fully recovered from the training burnout. Expression +100.

205627.text: There's always someone better than you. Don't be too complacent.

205628.text: Sniff... Being an idol is so hard... Can I really... shine like the others?

205629.text: On the way back, you comfort the upset Flora. Expression +50.

205630.text: Today, we're gonna practice the songs on the list. Go prepare for the mid-point showcase as a unit.

205632.text: Every time I think of the mid-point showcase, I get butterflies in my stomach...

205633.text: Me, too. I've tried to curb my anxiety intently, but it's just getting on my nerves more and more...

205634.text: $heroine$, is there any way to reduce my anxiety?

205635.text: Repeat to yourself that "I'm not nervous."

205636.text: Go to the new dessert café on the street after training.

205639.text: You got even more nervous during the training. Singing +50.

205641.text: I've seen the ads in the flyers in the arcade. It says the new chocolate cakes are at a discount.

205642.text: Great! Let's go there together after the training.

205643.text: You fully engage in the training today after relieving stress. Singing +100.

205644.text: The mid-point showcase is around the corner. To live your life with no regret, work up a sweat on the stage!

205646.text: I had a nightmare yesterday. I dreamed that I somehow stumbled on the stage while dancing and everyone laughed at me...

205648.text: $heroine$, what should I do if I stumble and everyone laughs at me?

205649.text: The only thing you can do is to try to ignore them and finish your performance.

205650.text: Your effort will pay off. Your performance will be a great success!

205651.text: But I don't think I can make it... I'm holding back everyone again... Sniff... Every time I think of that, my hair stands up on end...

205652.text: Oh no... Flora's getting all upset again...

205653.text: You can't focus on the dancing at all. Dancing +50.

205654.text: Yeah, that's right. Flora, you have to trust yourself. We've been working so hard together.

205655.text: Cheer up. Just take it as regular training. You can definitely make it.

205656.text: You make good use of your training time rather than let your imagination run wild. Dancing +100.

205657.text: Makeup not only changes your appearance, but also your soul.

205659.text: What does that mean? That sounded so complicated...

205660.text: Don't read too much into her words. It's just like matcha and donuts.

205662.text: Matcha is delicious, and so are donuts! If you mix them together, you get a matcha donut—which tastes even BETTER!

205663.text: That makes it even more complicated...

205665.text: I think you're just craving for some desserts...

205666.text: What? You actually understand her matcha-donut dialectic?

205667.text: See? You see? That's fantastic! Then let's get the makeup practice started the Ardisia's way...!

205668.text: Yeah... I think I got it... Probably... Expression +50.

205670.text: I've seen the ads in the flyers in the arcade. It says that the new matcha donuts are at a discount.

205671.text: Great! Let's go there together after the training.

205672.text: You've agreed to enjoy some matcha donuts after class. You feel energized. Expression +100.

205673.text: We have no training classes today?

205674.text: We're finally having the mid-point showcase tomorrow. Let's call it a day now.

205675.text: It's snowing outside. I've never seen snow before...

205676.text: $heroine$, let's go out for a snowball fight!

205677.text: Sure. Let's go out to have fun together. I won't lose!

205678.text: Having fun with the others makes you all warm inside. Cohesion +100.

205679.text: Flip this card, and you will be fascinated by your own fate.

205681.text: Pray to the stars, and get a glimpse of your future.

205682.text: The wheel of fate will keep on turning.

205683.text: Seems a special holiday is coming up.

205684.text: They say the Divination Crystal brings luck.

205693.text: To save the Forest of Elves, Flora decides to participate in the Dazzling Stage audition.

205694.text: Daily training for the idol audition.

205695.text: Wearing gorgeous clothes will make you shine onstage.

205696.text: Behind the glitz and glamour onstage is the sweat and grind offstage.

205697.text: Stirring up the crowd through performance is not an easy task. Conquer the stage through practice!

205698.text: Dorin has expertly prepared a mock performance for tomorrow's mid-point showcase.

205699.text: Flora is distracted by the disturbance offstage. If this continues, will she be alright at tomorrow's mid-point showcase?

205700.text: After seven days of hard work, today's performance will determine if you pass and go on to the next stage.

205706.text: The responsibility of protecting the Forest of Elves is too heavy for Flora to bear.

205707.text: With her conviction renewed, Flora tackles endurance training with vigor.

205708.text: Flora, once a shy individual, is beginning to change.

205709.text: Through the fire and the flames... The final stage, at last! Will Flora realize her dreams, and meet everyone's expectations...?

205710.text: After Flora and the others stepped onto the Dazzling Stage, Dorin now issues a new challenge to everyone.

205711.text: Hope I can make more friends

205712.text: If only I could read more people's emotions……

205808.text: I haven't seen you in a long while. All this time, I've been beating myself up for not being able to keep you company...

205810.text: Thank you for your hard work while I was gone.

205811.text: Master, please don't walk out on us like that again. Running the Chrono Tower is hard, yes, but it's nothing compared to the pain caused by your departure...

205812.text: (Hands over a letter) Everyone in the tower has been missing you. They wrote you this letter.

205813.text: It's the first time I've ever been on such a big stage~~ Let's enjoy our show together~~

205814.text: Thanks for the support, everyone... I'm still a lil' new to this, but I'll do my best! Thanks again!

205815.text: I'm so overwhelmed by all your support... I... I'll do my best to deserve it!

205816.text: Thank you for your support, everyone! We're Snow Memoria! Did you like that song? Wanna hear another?

205818.text: $heroine$, did you hear? That new band Snow Memoria is making all kinds of waves. I wanna see them live!

205820.text: Oh! It's you guys! You're with Snow Memoria! Please, take me to one of your concerts!

205822.text: Snow Memoria was amazing! Everyone looked so confident on stage, and their dance was breathtaking.

205823.text: Seeing them all on the stage, overcoming so many difficulties for their dreams... is truly inspiring.

205824.text: Thank you. I'll be sure to relay those kind words.

205825.text: I'll be cheering for Snow Memoria at the next concert, too! I will always be there to support them!

205826.text: With Primula supporting us in the audience, it's gonna be a great show for sure.

205829.text: In my hometown, people make wishes during the Spring Festival.

205830.text: What did you wish for, Tuonel?

205831.text: My wish is to change myself and make new friends...

205832.text: $heroine$, could you tell me what your wish is?

205835.text: Master, I've put up new decorations in the Hall of Origin.

205843.text: Commercial Street Entrance, A Small Town, Lunia

205844.text: $heroine$, Matveiffe, here we are! This is my hometown!

205845.text: Valentine's Day is on its way, and there's no better place to get you in the festive spirit.

205846.text: Look at that gigantic chocolate ornament hanging over there! And those people in their Valentine's Day finery really get dressed up more than usual.

205850.text: Hehe, I've never introduced my hometown like this.

205851.text: I'm so glad you came and we could hang out!

205852.text: This is my first time here. The locals seem to have a different wavelength from those I met before.

205855.text: This street is bustling. Let's take a look around.

205856.text: Speaking of this street... during Valentine's Day, the stores here have all kinds of candy, chocolates, and beautifully packaged gifts for sale.

205857.text: Lovers come here to buy presents for each other.

205858.text: And Look at those clothes of various styles—they're only sold here on Valentine's Day!

205859.text: I'm sensing a zealous wavelength off the store owners. And the people here... they have all kinds of... Uh, it's jarring.

205861.text: Yep. This is the busiest commercial street in town. People come here from all over to celebrate Valentine's Day.

205862.text: Those people over there—are they fighting?

205863.text: Fighting? But that's not a Valentine's Day custom.

205865.text: Maybe they're just debating something.. $heroine$, let's go check it out, shall we?

205866.text: As they make their way into the crowd, the noises grow louder and the couples around them grow more excited.

205868.text: Are you okay, Matveiffe? If you don't feel well, let's take a break.

205869.text: Those people... they're pointing fingers at each other, unaware that they're being watched.

205873.text: Chocolate Factory, A small town, Lunia

205874.text: Ugh... this one is supposed to go here. And what's with the ugly shape? Did those people work with their eyes closed?

205875.text: What's the point of celebrating Valentine's Day? Just another trick to coax people to spend more. And I have to work extra hours on this day just so my boss can earn more. This sucks.

205876.text: But I'm just a lowly worker. There's nothing I can do about it... Ugh, if I wasn't the only person working today, I wouldn't complain.

205877.text: Collen has already vanished this morning. And then Moor said to me, "I'll leave you to finish the rest this afternoon," and then puff, gone too. So here am I, picking up everyone's pieces. It kinda sucks.

205878.text: Now it's just me and a bunch of chocolates and candy... But don't you gloat, my little friends. Soon you'll become beautifully wrapped products and will end up melting in people's mouths.

205879.text: (Works while talking to himself) But at least you guys look pretty and taste sweet. What about me? I don't have Collen's handsome face, nor do I have Moor's sweet mouth. I... No one wants to talk to me. No one pays attention to me.

205880.text: I wish I could be like everybody else... holding the hand of the girl I love, talking and laughing with her as we stroll down the street. Or failing that, I wish I had a crush on someone and that I could be preparing a present for her right now...

205881.text: As he's going back to work after sitting there in a trance, he accidentally drops something.

205882.text: (Frustrated) What a klutz I am! What can I do right now? This is definitely not the way I want to realize my dream.

205883.text: Commercial Street, A Small Town, Lunia

205885.text: What's going on...? Why are those couples fighting and arguing? Trust me, $heroine$, this is not what my hometown supposed to look like...

205888.text: Let's go check out that store over there, the one with the chocolate decoration. I'm curious to find out what local chocolates taste like.

205889.text: Yeah, me too. I miss the taste of chocolates.

205890.text: Cynetia pushes open the door and enters the store before the others do. The wind chimes make a crisp sound, followed by the noise of something being moved from behind the counter.

205891.text: Ah, just a minute. Business has been booming lately, so I never got around to sorting the goods until now.

205892.text: Oh, I think I just tripped over something... What is it?

205894.text: Whoa?! Something's moving behind the counter.

205895.text: (Takes out her weapon and steps in front of the other two) Watch out!

205896.text: (A head sticks out from the mess of goods behind the counter) What are you... Relax, lady. This is an honest-to-goodness store!

205899.text: Of course I do, Lady Eulalia... It's been a while...

205900.text: (Leans close to Cynetia and whispers) Don't call me that. I just got out. Don't want them to find out I'm here...

205901.text: But... Lady Eulalia, you really don't recognize me?

205902.text: Nope, I've never seen that lovely face of yours before. And I certainly don't follow what you're getting at...

205903.text: Oh, and you two over there, feel free to browse and pick what you like.

205904.text: As a Valentine's Day offer, buy chocolates and get flowers for free. Available in limited quantities. First come, first served.

205905.text: Cynetia, she may be the Eulalia you knew from before, but don't dwell on it. Let it go.

205907.text: These chocolates are so beautifully wrapped. I want them.

205908.text: These are delicious too, with a quite familiar taste that could bring me back to my childhood.

205909.text: Buy them all if you like them.

205910.text: Good taste. These are our best sellers.

205911.text: Here are the complimentary flowers that come with the chocolates. Have a good day!

205913.text: We meant to ask the store owner about the arguing thing but we just forgot completely, all getting diverted by these chocolates and candy.

205914.text: Alas, I was right there in front of Lady Eulalia, and she didn't recognize me...

205915.text: Why do the two of you look so upset? Don't worry, we'll sort this out. Let's eat some chocolates first.

205916.text: Matveiffe unwraps a chocolate, hands it to Cynetia, and then puts another one in her own mouth.

205918.text: I've missed the candy of my hometown. It's a shame everything's changed except for the holiday store.

205919.text: Ugh... I wish I could show you what the street used to look like, how people exchanged gifts with a smile on their faces...

205921.text: We will find out what's going on

205923.text: It's dinner time already? I saw an eatery on my way in.

205924.text: You must be talking about Rolter's Restaurant. Their steaks are famous around town.

205925.text: I'm not much of a meat person... but I'd like to try their "famous" steaks.

205926.text: Has this place been refurbished? Feels different somehow...

205927.text: It's so dark in here. I nearly missed my step and fell down the stairs!

205928.text: I remember this place used to have a couple candlesticks, a hollowed-out window, and paintings of various themes hanging on every wall.

205929.text: Now it's just with bare stone walls. And instead of candlesticks, there are only a few kerosene lamps suspended from the ceiling.

205931.text: Perhaps the owner overhauled this place on a whim...

205932.text: Why don't we sit down and look at the menu?

205933.text: The grilled steak you mentioned, shall I order it?

205934.text: Grilled steak? I would never eat something that salty. If you ask me, let's order butter bread. It's filling AND not salty.

205935.text: Bread? No way, I'm not gonna eat that. Grilled steaks, that's what we agreed on. I'm not leaving until I eat it!

205938.text: $heroine$, you're a big liar! You promised me one thing but did another, just to please Cynetia!

205939.text: $heroine$, does my opinion not matter to you..? I'm so disappointed I'm losing my appetite.

205940.text: ...What's wrong, guys? If you're upset about something, let's talk about it.

205941.text: I'm upset about everything that has happened tonight! Forget about dinner. I'm off to bed now!

205942.text: No, upset doesn't cover it. I'm sad... I'm in no mood for dinner either. I'm going out for a walk.

205943.text: The two stand up without a word to each other and leave the restaurant in a huff, leaving the witch alone at the table.

205946.text: Residential Area, A Small Town, Lunia

205947.text: For the life of me, I can't figure out why they acted the way they did yesterday... And now they're both holed up in their own rooms and don't even want to talk to me anymore.

205948.text: This must be the residential area. I'll go and ask around.

205949.text: You dragged me out here so early in the morning, just for going in circles around the neighborhood? What are you thinking?

205950.text: I noticed you've been in a bad mood lately, so I thought a walk outside might help you feel better. Is there a place you wanna go to?

205951.text: I don't wanna go anywhere. I'm just in a bad mood because of you!

205952.text: What's going on? Hey, don't go. At least let me know what I'm doing wrong...

205953.text: You two seemed to have some sort of a falling out. What happened?

205954.text: Well, to be honest, I have no idea. It's Valentine's Day and I bought her favorite chocolates, but after that she started picking fights with me over the smallest things.

205955.text: Like the one you just overheard. I don't know what the fuss was about.

205956.text: I mean, I don't understand. She has been like a different person these last days. She was really gentle and thoughtful before, always there to comfort me when I'm down... Something must be wrong.

205957.text: It really sounds weird. Have you heard other people run into this situation?

205958.text: I did hear a neighbor complain about how his family was fighting all day too. Eventually, he couldn't handle it and went to the clinic.

205959.text: I thought that was an overreaction, seeing a doctor because of a quarrel...

205960.text: Do you know where the clinic is? I'd like to pay a visit.

205961.text: Head in the direction of the park along the commercial street, and you'll see it soon. Well then, If you'll excuse me, I gotta go find her.

205963.text: A small building has walls covered with white tiles, and a sign like that on the front... This must be the clinic.

205964.text: The witch pushes open the door and takes a look around. It's all pitch-dark save for the flickering candle light not far away.

205966.text: (Tightens her grip on the staff) Something's pulling me in?!

205967.text: Such an exquisite face. So soft to the touch, just like...

205969.text: What, it doesn't look like one to you? I spent a fortune building it.

205971.text: Hahaha, I've been wanting to try this for ages. It's bound to impress visitors!

205972.text: Amorai, for the last time! Enough with your stupid pranks! You'll give the patient a heart attack!

205973.text: ...Ahem. Are you here to seek treatment? We're an authorized clinic. Doctor Amorai here may be a little eccentric, but she's a skilled doctor.

205974.text: ...It's not me who needs treatment. It's my friends.

205975.text: Hmm... They're not with you? I can't make a diagnosis if they're not here.

205976.text: (Frowns) Actually... they're all fine physically. It's just that they seem to have gone through a change of personality. Nothing I ever did was good enough for them.

205977.text: That symptom rings a bell. My dearest Sally, you must remember how many people have come here for that.

205978.text: Don't address me like that. Sounds weird.

205979.text: So far our clinic has received 46 patients with that symptom. Some patients didn't show up themselves but sent their families here to consult about the condition. So we're not clear on the exact number of people with that affliction.

205980.text: That pretty much sums it up. So, how can I help you?

205981.text: Do you want me to prescribe some medicine to alleviate your friends' condition? That'll cost you.

205982.text: I want to know what caused the symptom and if there's a cure for it.

205983.text: I hate to admit it, but I have yet to find the cure.

205984.text: It's not all hopeless though. If I could pin down the exact cause of the disease, I could come up with a cure.

205985.text: But in reality, some patients who suffer from the disease never showed up and only sent their families here to consult doctors. And those who did show up never cooperated and always ended up leaving the clinic in a huff, all the while cursing and swearing.

205986.text: It's just as Doctor Amorai said. Every time I tried to perform a routine checkup on a patient, they accused me of being a charlatan and turned around to leave.

205987.text: Sounds tricky. So, what can I do to get my friends back to normal?

205988.text: Simple. Just get them here to go through a checkup. Or just tell me what it is that caused their symptom.

205989.text: I'm afraid I can't... They don't listen to me anymore. Can you guys help with that?

205990.text: We? We're just doctors. We don't get involved in people's private business.

205991.text: I have no personal interest in finding out the cause of the disease anyway. I just do what I get paid to do and keep this clinic afloat.

205992.text: If that's the case, the patients will never get a diagnosis...

205993.text: The quickest course of action is to just tell us what caused their disease and pay up. Then you'll get the cure you desired.

205994.text: Now if you'll excuse me, I still have a clinic to run.

205995.text: I agree with what Doctor Amorai said. And as a nurse, there's nothing I can do to help. Come back if you need anything else.

205997.text: Got nothing to go on. Wandering on the street is not going to help...

205998.text: The clinic remains the only clue. I should visit it again.

205999.text: She pushes open the clinic's door and what unfolds before her is a bright interior without a trace of the grim darkness that greeted her yesterday. She looks around, and there's not a soul in sight.

206003.text: I came to this town with a bunch of friends, but now I'm all alone. I don't know my way around here. I'm getting nowhere with my investigation...

206004.text: And so you decided to come back here?

206005.text: Yes, I still hope you can help me. If not directly, maybe point me in the right direction.

206006.text: Like I said, running this clinic is the only thing I care about. I have zero interest in other people's affairs.

206007.text: But... if more people came down with the disease, you'd end up receiving fewer patients, right?

206008.text: Think about it. One thing people with the disease have in common is that they refuse treatment.

206010.text: If this continues, Nurse Sally will not be able to get paid. And when that happens, don't you think she will leave you?

206011.text: By the way, is she not here?

206014.text: She didn't come to work this morning. She contacted me only once to ask me to leave her alone, saying she needed rest.

206015.text: I'm afraid she got the strange disease too.

206016.text: You're right. If this continues, I will be left to run the clinic alone, without help. Business will keep getting worse and eventually I will have to close it down.

206018.text: (Sighs) Fine, I will investigate the disease with you, but only to save myself from going bankrupt.

206022.text: This place looks like just an ordinary park.

206023.text: You sure we'll find clues here?

206024.text: (Yawns) If you don't believe me, go home and sleep.

206026.text: Seems like I don't have a choice...

206027.text: This place is a favorite hangout of the locals. They come here for walks all the time.

206028.text: Hey, look. Isn't that Simo over there?! Yeah, that's him. The best-looking man I've ever seen!

206029.text: What is he doing here? I've always wanted to talk to him but never got the chance to.

206030.text: You have a chance now. If you don't hurry, I'll go ahead and talk to him first.

206031.text: Come on, don't do that. This is supposed to be a fair contest. Wait up!

206032.text: Not far away, there is an average-looking man strolling along the flower bed. Soon he finds himself surrounded by a swarm of girls.

206033.text: Where's this good-looking man they talked about?

206035.text: There's no one else in sight other than that man over there and those girls.

206037.text: Let's tail them for a bit

206038.text: They're headed for the restaurant. Come on, let's follow them.

206041.text: Not sure what that man has said to those girls who surrounded him, but now he is all alone at the table in the restaurant, waiting for his lunch. At the table next to him are two familiar-looking figures.

206042.text: Look at that man. So handsome!

206044.text: Tell me about it. I don't even want to talk to $heroine$ anymore.

206045.text: But looking at him, I just know that we can talk forever.

206047.text: (Moves her seat closer to the man's) Hehe, that makes us competitors! I'm making a move now!

206048.text: (Moves her seat too) Hey! Not so fast!

206052.text: Huh, a strange symptom indeed. And a rare sight, too. Gotta record it for later study.

206053.text: The witch tightens her grip on her wand and walks straight to the man's table, closely followed by Amorai.

206054.text: What are you doing? Why are you standing at my table when there are empty seats over there?

206055.text: (Points at Cynetia and Matveiffe) What have you done to them?

206057.text: (Mouth open in surprise) Oh, $heroine$? What are you doing here?

206058.text: I've done nothing. I don't even know them!

206059.text: They're my friends, but now they won't talk to me—and yet somehow they're attracted to you.

206062.text: I don't know what to say. I don't have a clue, I swear!

206063.text: If you don't believe me, why did you ask me?

206064.text: (Raises her staff) You leave me no choice.

206066.text: W-what did you hit me for? Stop it or I'm calling the cops!

206067.text: Do you have any idea what you got yourself into?

206069.text: I don't know what you're talking about. I'm just a worker! Why can't I just eat in peace?!

206070.text: Looks like you have no intention of answering $heroine$'s question. Fine, we've got all day. We'll wait here until you're ready to talk. How's that?

206071.text: You have no right to do this. Let go of me. I need to get back to work!

206072.text: The restaurant is now crowded with onlookers. Cynetia and Matveiffe are still looking at Simo with worried expressions on their faces. Then from the circle of onlookers emerges an unassuming girl.

206073.text: Please show him mercy... I know this man.

206074.text: Simo, right? Remember the other night? I was walking down a dark alley on my way home from work and was stopped by a thug. I didn't have anything on me that could be used as a weapon. I was cornered.

206075.text: I wanted to scream for help, but the thug threatened me not to. Just as I was about to be taken... you showed up and stepped between me and the thug, telling me to run.  I was so scared I was incapable of thinking. I managed to escape, but I never knew what happened to you.

206076.text: Since then I've never dared to go out at night and I've been wanting to see you again, to thank you in person. Never thought I'd meet you here. I just know that a good Samaritan like you would never do anything evil.

206078.text: Simo lowers his head thoughtfully, as if recalling the details of that night or pondering over something else.

206079.text: Well, if I'm being honest, I'm not the saint you think I am... That night I did something any righteous man would do, that's all.

206080.text: The question she asked—I do have something to do with it...

206082.text: A few days ago, I received a batch of chocolates from a stranger, with a note saying that these chocolates had been enchanted and people who eat a piece of this would easily fall for me. Though I felt lonely, I was still dismissive of this dirty trick. However, as I was dealing with the mess left by my coworkers, the enchanted chocolates got mixed up with the normal ones by accident.

206083.text: I didn't dare to tell the truth because I might get fired for this. Due to the arrival of Valentine's Day, chocolates have all been sold out and I can't track down those affected. I've been feeling awful these days but now it feels good to spit it out. Here is the recipe for lifting that enchantment, please help me make the cures and bring those affected back to normal.

206084.text: After handing the recipe to Amorai, Simo lowers his head and stands there awkwardly.

206085.text: (Chuckles) It was just an accident and we all know you didn't do it on purpose. Don't worry about it. We'll work together to get everything back on track.

206086.text: And... you just said you felt lonely... If I stayed to keep you company, would you feel better? Your heroic deeds of that night have been imprinted on my mind and I hope there will not be a day of my life when you are not by my side. Would you like to hold my hand and get me through the darkness?

206087.text: Simo raises his head with a blushing face, and gently takes the girl's hand. His eyes seem to twinkle in the lights of the restaurant.

206088.text: I give you my word. I will always protect you.

206089.text: A scatter of applauses rise from the onlooking crowd and grow in a crescendo. Amorai takes the witch by the hand and sneaks off.

206091.text: If it weren't for me, you would have made a scene.

206092.text: Come back to the clinic with me, then take the cures and go find your friends.

206094.text: Don't mention it. Just remember to pay me.

206095.text: I'm going to pay a visit to Sally in the convent.

206100.text: Was I out for long? I think I dreamt of being in a crowded and noisy restaurant. The next thing I remember, Matveiffe and I came back to sleep...

206101.text: But... in the dream I said a lot of things to $heroine$ that I shouldn't have...

206102.text: I think we were having the same dream...

206103.text: No need to break a sweat over a dream

206104.text: Maybe the dream will become reality

206105.text: (Strokes the bandage around her wrist) Crap... Did I really... say those things to $heroine$?

206106.text: According to the wavelength I just detected, $heroine$ was lying. So don't worry...

206107.text: Why don't you two rest a while here? I've got to go to the convent to meet my new friend.

206108.text: $heroine$ already made a new friend? How long have I been asleep?

206109.text: Aw... is $heroine$ going to abandon me?

206110.text: Ugh, $heroine$ has left without a word...!

206111.text: What do we do? I detect anger in $heroine$'s wavelength.

206114.text: How do you feel now, my dearest Sally? That was an orange-flavored cure specially made for you.

206115.text: (Wakes up with a slight flush on her face) Amorai? Why am I here...? I remember refusing to go to work and hitting the sack...

206116.text: ...Oh! How did you get me to drink the potion?! It was delicious though. There's still an aftertaste of orange in my mouth...

206117.text: Relax, I will never harm you. Good thing you don't live far. Otherwise, it wouldn't have been so easy to get to you.

206118.text: As for the cure, are you sure you want to know what happened?

206119.text: Well then, now that you're well-rested, come back to work! Also, I'll have to dock your pay for the time you missed.

206121.text: At dusk, the witch and Amorai meet on time at the convent entrance.

206122.text: Is this enough to pay for the cures?

206123.text: Thank you for your patronage. You're just the kind of person I like!

206124.text: Oh, and about your earlier request, it's been taken care of. Consider it a small favor from me. I already had the cures delivered to the convent. They will distribute them to the patients in town.

206125.text: Hehe, who would've thought we'd need an outsider like you to look out for our town.

206126.text: (Cheeks flush from exertion) $heroine$, phew... finally caught up to you.

206127.text: (Cheeks flush from exertion) Phew... we... heard you came to the convent, so we got here as soon as we could.

206129.text: We... we think you're still mad.

206130.text: So... we want to cheer you up a bit...

206133.text: Hehe, this is a costume that's sold only on Valentine's Day. I thought you'd like it!

206134.text: I bought one too. It's so pretty.

206135.text: So... $heroine$, which one of us do you think looks better?

206136.text: $heroine$ likes my costume much more, right?

206138.text: (Sniggers) Haha... Valentine's Day is the best!

206139.text: The setting sun bathes the town in a golden glow that seems to match the joy of its residents on this festive day.

206140.text: Oh, you noticed me... Actually I got you a gift too. Here you are.

206142.text: You actually chose me over Yui. I'm so glad... Here's a little something I made for you.

206143.text: This is the first time I've got such an amazing gift! In return, here are the chocolates made all by myself.

206144.text: Is this a reward for me? Well then... I'll share my favorite chocolate with you!

206145.text: Thank you. And here's a little token of my appreciation.

206146.text: Oh, is this... for me? Well, actually... I got you a little something too...

206147.text: Thank you. I got you a gift too. Let's start the celebration!

206148.text: ...Mmm... I will cherish it. And... I want you to have this. Don't get the wrong idea. I'm just being polite.

206149.text: Thank you. And take this. I don't want to owe you anything. Huh? Did I take it the wrong way? So it's a Valentine's Day gift...

206150.text: I'm surprised you knew what I liked... This is the chocolate I just bought. Consider it a return gift.

206151.text: You sure know how to please me. To show my appreciation, I'd like to give you this.

206152.text: This is for me? Wow, great minds think alike. I've also prepared chocolate for you.

206153.text: A gift for me? Haha, you sure live up to my expectations. Here's a little something for you.

206154.text: You sure I can have this...? I'll take good care of it. Here's my gift for you. Hope you'll take good care of it too...

206155.text: Before I went out today, the revelation said that something good would happen to me, and now it is fulfilled. I've got you a little something too, as a token of my appreciation.

206156.text: Hehe, it's so sweet. Want to try it?

206157.text: I appreciate it. To mark this special occasion, I got you a gift too.

206158.text: Looks like today is my lucky day. Hehe, I'd like to share my luck with you.

206159.text: Didn't expect I'd get a gift from you. Hang on, I want to give you this as a return gift.
