207292.text: Another one healed up! Mister, make sure you get enough rest and don't move too much.

207293.text: Thank you, little girl. You're so young and yet you're already doing so much to help people. You really put this geezer to shame.

207296.text: Everybody, listen up. This Magical Abnormality must have been engineered by the Protector!

207297.text: Think about it, who else could have produced magic waves strong enough to cause mutations in us!?

207298.text: You Ovates are at the beck and call of the Protector. You must be in on it, too. Guys, do not let her fool you!

207299.text: That's... that's not true! Wah... Why is everyone turning so hostile...?

207300.text: Hmph, you think you can talk your way out of this!?

207301.text: I'm going to expose you people for who you are!

207302.text: Wah... How did it come to this...?

207304.text: How dare you get in my way!

207305.text: Look at the surging magic power. A sure sign of the presence of the supreme Withered... Argh!

207306.text: Impossible... How could I have been defeated by a damn frog after I have accepted the power of the Withered!?

207307.text: You accepted the power of the Withered?!

207308.text: Ahhh... It hurts. My feet... why are they turning into wood?

207309.text: Help... Help me! I don't want to become a monster!

207311.text: Hang on, let me help you. Behold the power of the Protector!

207313.text: Pfft, worthless piece of trash. Couldn't even defeat a frog and a girl.

207314.text: Withered Heart, your little game ends now!

207315.text: And you're not getting away this time!

207316.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah, my noblest chevalier. If you think you can catch me so easily, you have another thing coming.

207319.text: Damn it, Withered Heart got away again.

207320.text: At least we kept the villagers safe.

207321.text: You're right. As a chevalier, my foremost duty is to help people in distress.

207323.text: Great glorious chevalier, I'm truly grateful for your help, and thank you too, Ovate.

207326.text: It's alright, you were being manipulated by Withered Heart. Ovate Yothaya won't take it personally, right?

207327.text: Yeah, your feet haven't healed up yet. Stay still. I'm going to cast another healing spell on you.

207330.text: Don't worry, Yothaya is a good healer, she will fix him up well.

207331.text: I've cleansed the Abnormality in this area with my wand. Let's keep chasing after Withered Heart.

207332.text: Withered Heart's presence is growing stronger. This is not good.

207333.text: And these monsters are getting stronger, too. We've got a tough fight ahead of us.

207334.text: Don't worry. I'll fight alongside you.

207335.text: Ribbit. With your help, we will stop Withered Heart for sure, and save Irminsul!

207336.text: Damn it, the Abnormality is very bad here. I'm guessing that many of the monsters here were once citizens of Irminsul...

207337.text: Don't think too much. Let's keep going.

207338.text: Ribbit... Up ahead is the sacrificial altar. I wonder how Flare is doing with the cleansing ritual.

207339.text: Ugh, why isn't it obeying my command!?

207341.text: The stone golem is going berserk... We gotta help Flare!

207342.text: Flare, what on earth happened here?

207343.text: Stay away from me! I'm a monster!

207346.text: Ribbit. Your mutation is nothing compared to mine.

207347.text: You don't understand. I'm the priestess of Irminsul, I can't let people see me like this!

207348.text: Don't despair, Flare, I'm sure the Protector has a way to fix your appearance.

207349.text: The Abnormality has done a number on this place. Looks like the cleansing ritual didn't go well.

207350.text: Yes. I was getting to the crucial part of the ritual when a strange creature came out of nowhere and attacked me.

207351.text: That's how I became like this. The stone golem got out of control, the ritual was derailed... All my efforts went down the drain!

207352.text: I will find that creature and make it pay! I swear!

207354.text: Yeah, you need to stay calm. You're the strongest priestess of Irminsul, after all. There's gotta be another way to stop the Abnormality.

207355.text: I don't know what happened to me, but somehow I can use magic now. Maybe I can help you restart the ritual.

207357.text: You guys possess such pure magic. And Phrygia, how come you have such powerful magic inside you?

207358.text: Ribbit. Maybe it's a gift from the Protector.

207359.text: Anyway, let's restart the ritual before it's too late!

207361.text: Just follow my instructions, and the ritual will resume in no time.

207362.text: As magic flows in, the huge magic circle radiates a dazzling light. The wind carries the untainted magic of life to every corner of Irminsul.

207363.text: As the breeze blows by, everything comes back to life, and the strange magic waves fade from the air...

207364.text: We did it! We actually did it!

207367.text: Flare, your commitment to protecting your people will not waver because of your physical changes.

207368.text: I can't help get your old appearance back, but I'm sure the Protector can.

207369.text: You're right, Phrygia. We need Protector's help if we are to fully cleanse Irminsul.

207370.text: You guys go ahead and get back to the Protector. I'm going to have a look around and learn more about the Abnormality.

207371.text: Hi stranger, could you help me with something?

207373.text: That's weird. We've never met before, and yet you know my name.

207375.text: I see. Looks like my memory's getting worse with age. So, it must be destiny that we meet again.

207376.text: Ribbit. Hi there, what do you need?

207377.text: As a chevalier, I'd be glad to help out.

207378.text: Honorable chevalier, those monsters snatched the keepsake my poor wife left me.

207379.text: As you can see, I'm in pretty rough shape. I can't get it back by myself.

207380.text: Ribbit. I've got good news for you, friend.

207381.text: I can fix up your body with my wand. Just watch!

207383.text: How... can this be? Why didn't it work?

207385.text: You go help him get his wife's keepsake back. I'll stay here and figure something out.

207386.text: No... no! This can't be true...

207388.text: It's Withered Heart. It showed up and attacked Ökam when I wasn't looking.

207390.text: I failed to stop it... Oh jeez...

207391.text: *Cough* You're back... There it is, that's the keepsake my wife left me... Oh, my poor darling...

207392.text: Please... *cough* Please hang it on the branch... And thank you for your help.

207393.text: No... This can't be. Why can't I heal this poor man with my wand...?

207394.text: Even the power I received from the Protector is slipping away from me... Why?

207395.text: W-What am I even doing here...?

207396.text: I can feel magic power leaving my body...

207397.text: So everything happening here is all just my wishful thinking?

207399.text: Your efforts are not in vain.

207400.text: The cleansing ritual will save Irminsul.

207401.text: But... Irminsul, my homeland, is no more, isn't it?

207404.text: Looks like a lot of things happened after we got separated.

207405.text: Flare, you're a figment of my imagination too, aren't you?

207406.text: It's all pointless. Everything I did was pointless.

207407.text: Flare suddenly waves her hand, and a burst of magical energy shoots out at Phrygia, who reflexively steps back.

207408.text: If I'm not real, why did you dodge?

207409.text: ...Looks like Raphan's kick wasn't hard enough.

207411.text: Look, Phrygia, I don't have time for this nonsense.

207412.text: I've got three pieces of good news and one piece of bad news. Which do you want to hear first?

207413.text: The... three pieces of good news.

207414.text: Norn and Yui helped the townsfolk fend off the attacking monsters, and now they're helping to rebuild the town.

207415.text: The refugees Yothaya was charged with looking after moved to the town where Norn and Yui are staying. They're all settling in fine.

207416.text: The sentry camp under Raphan's protection has few casualties. Raphan is now putting together a team to wipe out the remaining monsters.

207417.text: The cleansing ritual was a success. The Magical Abnormality in Irminsul will end soon.

207419.text: The Protector is now defending Irminsul against Withered Heart.

207420.text: Yet her most loyal chevalier is lying here shouting nonsense.

207422.text: I... I see. Thank you, Flare.

207423.text: Lady Flare, Sir Phrygia, you guys are here.

207424.text: Follow me. The Protector needs your help.

207425.text: A familiar-looking throne, a familiar-looking figure. Asherah is holding aloft the "Sentience" that symbolizes the supreme power of Irminsul. Before her are strange creatures exuding an overwhelming aura of decay.

207426.text: You... You people should all be destroyed!

207427.text: You have no idea what your beloved Protector is doing!

207428.text: Hahaha, surprised, huh? I am your Protector's shadow, her own creation!

207429.text: It's only a matter of time before you all end up like me!

207430.text: Shut it. You talk too much.

207431.text: How could a damn frog hold such great power...?

207432.text: Asherah, I'm not done with you. Just wait!

207434.text: I'm truly impressed with your power.

207435.text: Thank you for the compliment, Protector.

207436.text: As the glorious chevalier of Irminsul, I'd like to know if there's any truth to Withered Heart's claim...

207438.text: How dare you believe that monster's nonsense and doubt the Protector!

207439.text: I'm not doubting the Protector. It's just that, as a chevalier, it's my duty to investigate and eliminate anything that might harm Irminsul.

207440.text: You must stop what you are doing and back off.

207441.text: Since you have done me a great service, I will ignore what you just said. But if you persist in your ways, you will be destroyed.

207443.text: Protector, I used to be your loyal chevalier, but not anymore. Now my loyalty belongs to the people of Irminsul.

207444.text: I will not unsheathe my sword against you this time. Instead, I will look for answers in my own chivalric ways.

207445.text: Protector, seeing you again, hearing your voice... that's more than I could have asked for.

207447.text: Stop right there. You are but a speck of dust. What makes you think you stand any chance?

207449.text: A Witch from afar. Strange, there's something familiar about your aura...

207450.text: No matter. You people still stand no chance.

207451.text: Protector, do you want me to stop them?

207452.text: Let them go. I have something else to attend to.

207453.text: If you are worried for them, by all means, go help them.

207454.text: Understood. I will leave you to your rest, then.

207455.text: Actually, I'm aware that nothing here is real.

207457.text: I'm fine. I know what's going on.

207458.text: I have too many regrets in life, tormenting me. That's how the Music Box of Time brought us here and created these illusions.

207459.text: Actually, it doesn't matter to me that none of this is real.

207460.text: What matters is that through this trip I understand what it really means to be a chevalier.

207461.text: When Irminsul fell, I became lost... Thankfully you were there for me. You gave me a silver lining.

207462.text: Now, I find power in being a chevalier, and that power fills every fiber of my being and gives me strength.

207463.text: Come on, let's go after Withered Heart. Let's leave no regrets!

207486.text: (Opens the letter in her hand and reads the contents of the letter as usual) Ella, it's been a while since I last saw you, and it's almost your birthday. I've watched you grow every step of the way. Like I said before, always move at your own pace.

207487.text: Come and visit us sometime.——Love, Your Dad

207489.text: What birthday surprise would my parents have prepared for me if they were here?

207490.text: (Passes by) Birthday surprise? Seems Ella's birthday is coming up.

207491.text: Master? Why are you standing there in the hallway? Something on your mind?

207493.text: Birthday? That calls for celebration. Now that we know Ella's birthday, why don't we ask the others about theirs?

207494.text: The others? I don't know their birthdays.

207495.text: But I do know that for them, birthdays are something to be celebrated. Let's do that, shall we?

207496.text: I agree. Let me know if you need anything.

207497.text: Yesterday I learned that Metamorphoses and Nocturna never had anyone celebrate their birthdays.

207498.text: Hehe, you're welcome. If it wasn't for me, you would never find out, $heroine$.

207500.text: A birthday cake is a must

207501.text: Master, I know where you can get ingredients for making a birthday cake. I'll guide you there.

207502.text: Cake? What cake? I want to try it, too!

207504.text: Shh! This is a secret operation

207506.text: Um, it wouldn't be secret if we told you...

207507.text: It's okay. We can tell her. The birthday girls are not here. But Lilia, you have to keep this a secret.

207508.text: конечно! Where I come from, we keep a secret like winter keeps the snow of Snegurochka—it's always there and never melts.

207509.text: I don't know what you're talking about... but if $heroine$ says it's okay to tell you, it's fine by me!

207510.text: The secret operation is... to celebrate the birthdays of Ella, Metamorphoses, and Nocturna. But there are some preparations to make.

207511.text: First of all, we need to get food ingredients and start making the birthday cake.

207512.text: I made cakes before, though it was more a spur-of-the-moment thing. But anyway, let me do it. I'm fired up already!

207513.text: Then I will help eat the cake!

207514.text: Uh, maybe add a little more cream here!

207515.text: Too much cream sours the taste. Let's add fruit instead.

207516.text: Smells nice! What are you guys... making here?

207517.text: Seems you guys have different ideas about how to make a birthday cake.

207518.text: Birthday cake? Someone's having a birthday?

207519.text: I'm planning on celebrating the birthdays of Ella, Metamorphoses, and Nocturna.

207520.text: (In a low voice) I envy them...

207521.text: Uh, I... I didn't say anything... Is there anything I can do to help?

207522.text: Tuonel, which do you think looks better?

207523.text: Check this out. It looks so pretty with fruit on top.

207524.text: Cream looks just as lovely on a cake. And it smells nice, too—it will make the cake more delicious.

207525.text: Well... Why don't we let $heroine$ be the judge?

207530.text: Master, the cake is almost done.

207531.text: Thank you guys. We managed to get the cake ready before their birthdays.

207532.text: Hehe, and I learned a lot of cake-making tricks in the process.

207533.text: I put a lot of work into this. Can't wait for them to try it and tell me what they think.

207534.text: $heroine$, now the only thing missing is the topper. Come on, put it on.

207536.text: Looks amazing. You guys are awesome...

207537.text: I couldn't pitch in on making the cake, so I will be decorating the party.

207539.text: I know I sounded urgent when I told you to come here. But don't worry, this is not a fight.

207541.text: I've never been near this room before.

207542.text: (Pushes the door open) It's pitch-dark in here...

207543.text: (The light suddenly comes on) Happy birthday!

207547.text: We're celebrating birthdays for you guys.

207548.text: Master put a lot of thought into this.

207549.text: Well, what do you think of the cake? Isn't it pretty?!

207550.text: Happy birthday! Mind telling me what you think after you try it?

207551.text: Never thought anyone here would remember my birthday.

207552.text: Feels so great to have people celebrate my birthday with me.

207553.text: Never thought this would ever happen to me...

207554.text: Everyone's so enthusiastic. Why don't we let our birthday girls make their wishes before eating the cake?

207555.text: Hope you guys like this party.

207556.text: Make a wish before trying the cake

207557.text: Standing before the cake, the three gently close their eyes to make their wishes.

207558.text: Then, after the candles are blown out, the Witch cuts the cake and distributes it among the girls.

207559.text: How's the cake? Is it good?

207560.text: I've never tried this taste before. So refreshing.

207563.text: The cake is so pretty I feel bad eating it...

207564.text: It will go to waste if left uneaten.

207567.text: It's just... you seemed so invested in preparing for this party.

207568.text: Really? I don't quite remember. Nor do I remember my own birthday. But still, I'm happy to be celebrating their birthdays.

207569.text: (Chuckles) I'll make more cakes for you in the future.

207579.text: Meow, can't believe it's been so long. Feels like yesterday when you first woke up.

207580.text: We're about to go on a journey. I'm excited to meet new friends.

207581.text: Got a new quest? Meow, go check it out.

207582.text: We've got a lot of work ahead of us. But if it were up to me, I would spend the whole year in bed. Meow.

207583.text: Phrygia snaps out of a dizzying spin and finds that he's no longer in the Chrono Tower.

207584.text: Dense woods, familiar voices. It feels like somewhere in the past.

207585.text: After learning what's going on, Phrygia embarks on a journey to save Irminsul.

207586.text: Monsters have invaded the town. This is bad news.

207587.text: Follow Phrygia to the cavern in the forest under Norn's guidance.

207588.text: The cavern is fraught with danger. Every step shapes the future.

207589.text: Withered Heart gets released, and Phrygia beats himself up for it. Irminsul hangs in the balance.

207590.text: Another Magical Abnormality occurs. The Sentry Camp falls under fierce attack from monsters.

207591.text: After getting himself together, Phrygia gets back on his journey to save Irminsul.

207592.text: Lots of refugees have gathered in the clearings in the woods. Anxiety quickly spreads and festers.

207593.text: Withered Heart flees all the way to the sacrificial altar. Something bad is afoot.

207594.text: The berserk stone golem, the terrifying aura of decay... It's in a mess at the sacrificial altar.

207595.text: The cleansing ritual is restarted. Withered Heart escapes, and the group chases after it...

207596.text: The once thriving and sacrosanct island now lies in shambles after the Withered Heart's invasion.

207597.text: Withered Heart rushes into the ruins. Phrygia, following closely behind, finally meets the Protector–the person he has been longing to see.

207598.text: This time, Phrygia is going to make things right.

207601.text: Master, there's a letter for you, sent from afar.

207603.text: Yes. Open it and have a look.

207605.text: It's Ardisia. She's inviting me on a vacation to her hometown, Burton in the Kingdom of Lochaber.

207606.text: Burton in the Kingdom of Lochaber... That's a nice place to spend a vacation.

207608.text: (shakes head) No, I've only heard about it.

207609.text: Burton is not just a famous resort. It's also home to many mysterious marine races.

207610.text: But what really sets Burton apart is that sea elves and humans there live together in peace.

207611.text: Maybe you will meet sea elves on your trip there. Legend says that if you hear them sing, you will have good luck.

207613.text: Yep. I wish you a happy vacation in Burton.

207614.text: This is Burton, the little town mentioned in the letter...

207615.text: Hi, pretty girl! Come to Burton for pleasure?

207617.text: Not much of a talker, are you? Here, have a soda. It's on the house. Better stay hydrated on this sizzling hot day. Wouldn't want to get heatstroke.

207619.text: Burton-special sea salt soda over here. Come take a look! Don't miss out!

207620.text: Ardisia was supposed to be here a while ago...

207621.text: The Witch sees a bottle washed up on the shore and crouches to pick it up. She opens it and finds a note inside that reads: "I have taken Ardisia. If you want to find her, do as I say. First, build a sand castle as tall as a person before nightfall (No magic allowed!)"

207623.text: Didn't expect to see you here.

207625.text: Likewise. You look upset. Something wrong?

207626.text: After learning that a young girl has been taken by a villain, the smile on Hilda's face freezes.

207627.text: The human girl... might have been taken by a sea elf.

207628.text: This is a serious matter. But first things first, I'll teach you how to build a perfect sand castle to appease the kidnapper. Then I'll call on the Chivalric Order to look into this.

207629.text: What I'm gonna show you is a result of years of practice, and I'm only gonna show you once, so watch carefully!

207630.text: That friend of yours you mentioned earlier—is she coming to Burton to hang out with you?

207631.text: Hmph! I'm not the type to hold a grudge over something that happened a year ago...

207632.text: Let's make a plan! Like... a bunch of friends going on an adventure together, that kind of thing...

207633.text: Ugh, I can't believe a mere human could be capable of this...

207634.text: Mom told me that one should be polite and never be a bother to others...

207635.text: Hmph! I'm a noble elf. I don't bother with humans.

207636.text: Hilda built the sand castle with such grace and ease. I'm impressed.

207637.text: That crab seems to be holding something in its claws. Let's see... Another note. Mission two: Find the glowing seashell on the beach before dawn.

207638.text: Still not allowed to use magic...?

207639.text: It's getting late. I'm a little hungry...

207640.text: ...There's a nice aroma of grilled fish in the air. Where did it come from?

207642.text: Delicious grilled fish. Smells like heaven! Have you tried it?

207643.text: Add some of Angling's exclusive spice. Huh?

207644.text: Sorry to disturb you. Your grilled fish smells very nice.

207645.text: Haha, thank you. If you like my grilled fish, I can give you this one!

207647.text: It's okay. I can get more fish from the sea!

207648.text: Some time has passed, and the girl is still not back. Worse, the waves are getting bigger...

207649.text: The waves are picking up. Is she gonna be okay...?

207651.text: Well, this is what you get for not sharing your grilled fish with me...

207654.text: What were you thinking, doing something so dangerous...?

207655.text: If you want to eat grilled fish, ask nicely.

207656.text: Nah, I'm good. I can easily make something more delicious myself.

207657.text: So Danelim is not interested in grilled fish after all... That's a shame, 'cause I had Mom make me tons of grilled fish today.

207658.text: Grilled... fish! Damn it... Well, since Ardisia has brought grilled fish, I guess I'll try it, out of courtesy.

207660.text: Don't forget to apologize to Angling.

207664.text: I'm wet all over... This sucks.

207665.text: Thank you for saving me. Name's Angling. Live in the fishing village nearby.

207666.text: You don't look like you're from around here. Are you a tourist? How come you're alone?

207667.text: My friend Ardisia was taken. I need to find her. The kidnapper left a note telling me that if I wanted to see her, I'd have to find a glowing seashell on the beach.

207668.text: Sorry to hear that... I'll help you search for the seashell. It's the least I can do for you after you saved my life.

207669.text: I heard from other villagers that some naughty sea elves like playing with human children and would secretly take them home...

207670.text: But don't worry too much. The sea elves are not bad by nature. I'm sure your friend is fine.

207671.text: Speaking of, I've seen a sea elf once. They look exactly the same as humans.

207673.text: Mm-hmm. That day, I just finished grilling the fish and put it aside. When I was not looking, a sea elf made off with it.

207674.text: The next day when she returned for more, I chased her off!

207675.text: There's a market nearby that gets very busy at night. Why don't you go check it out while I process the fish?

207676.text: Maybe you'll get useful info there.

207678.text: Such a bustling market, overflowing with goods.

207680.text: My wallet... It's gone... Did I drop it while swimming...?

207681.text: Ugh, can't believe I was sent to a human settlement!

207682.text: But Ardisia did say I'd be rewarded with something delicious when I get back...

207683.text: Hi, I lost my wallet. Could you loan me some money? I can trade you for it.

207686.text: Tsk, how could an imbecile who can't even keep a hold of their wallet become friends with Ardisia? (mutters)

207688.text: Ah... nothing, never mind. Here you go! I've got more money than I can spend. I can give you however much you want.

207689.text: Actually I don't need this much... But if you insist, I'll give you my most valuable possession.

207693.text: Why would sea monsters attack the market out of the blue? Go alert the Chivalric Order!

207694.text: Huh? These sea monsters, I remember putting them...

207695.text: Stay calm, everyone. I'll take care of these monsters.

207696.text: I don't know what's going on... but this sucks!

207697.text: The sea monsters all ran away...

207698.text: Of course they did. They were afraid of me!

207700.text: Human, don't act chummy with me. You're not worthy!

207701.text: With a pout, Danelim walks off and soon disappears.

207702.text: Ah... The stuff she bought, and her wallet...

207704.text: You mean... you left your wallet and other stuff at the market?

207706.text: Enough. You're the one at fault here... Danelim, you were being bad today.

207707.text: Ugh... Accursed humans! This is not over!

207708.text: Oh, thank you so much. If it weren't for you, God knows what would have happened.

207709.text: You're so strong for someone your age.

207710.text: It's nothing, really... Oh, and have you seen a girl who looks like this?

207711.text: Hmm, let me see... Ah, it's that kid. She hung out around here quite a lot but stopped showing up a few days ago.

207712.text: Don't worry. I know everything that goes on in these parts. I'll ask around for you.

207714.text: You're the great savior of the Burton market. Everyone would be happy to help you out.

207715.text: Come here anytime if you're hungry. My food is all yours to eat!

207716.text: That'd be nice. By the way, the girl who was here with me a while ago, do you know where she lives?

207717.text: Oh, that girl, she showed up at the market from time to time. I don't know who her parents are...

207718.text: Strange. Burton is a small town. I know every kid around here except those two. I have no idea who their parents are or where they live.

207719.text: Thanks for the info. These are her belongings she left behind. I'll leave them here with you. Please give them back to her when she returns.

207721.text: You're back. I just finished grilling the fish. Come eat it while it's still hot.

207723.text: Sea monsters? No... it's been quite peaceful around here.

207725.text: Tell her what happened at the market.

207726.text: Are you hurt? Sea monsters are ferocious!

207727.text: I'm fine. They've been driven out.

207728.text: Strange. Sea monsters are capricious by nature, yes, but I've never heard of them attacking a human market before...

207729.text: Oh well, whatever. Come on, let's dig in, before it gets cold.

207730.text: When we're done eating, we'll go look for that glowing seashell!

207732.text: Hehe, I grill a mean fish. Just between us, I learned to grill fish from a sea elf I met by chance.

207733.text: The two quickly finish the grilled fish. The moonlight reflects on the sea. Faint music wafts over from somewhere far away.

207734.text: Now that we're well-fed, let's go find that glowing seashell!

207736.text: Can't believe it's already late night, and we still haven't found the glowing seashell.

207737.text: If we can't find it in time, you'll never see your friend again...

207738.text: Come on, Angling, use your smart brain to think...

207740.text: Looking in the direction the Witch points, Angling sees a bright light coming from behind a reef.

207743.text: I always get what I want, haha...

207744.text: First, I have those two get me that glowing seashell. Then, I bring that meddler to her knees.

207745.text: I'm a genius for coming up with such a brilliant plan!

207746.text: Such a beautiful seashell belongs in my castle. Only a noble elf like me is worthy of it!

207747.text: Haha, those stupid humans have no idea I'm playing them for suckers!

207748.text: Up to no good again, aren't you, Danelim?

207749.text: No, I can explain, Ardisia... Oh, that was sleep-talking. Gave me a scare there...

207750.text: Wow, so the glowing seashell is real. And it's bigger than I thought!

207751.text: But how do we move something this big?

207752.text: Maybe we can tie it to a rope and drag it?

207753.text: Hey look, there happens to be a thick rope over here.

207754.text: Phew~knot the rope like this, and pull the rope, and then we can easily drag it away~

207755.text: Stop. What are you two doing?!

207756.text: What does it look like? We're taking this glowing seashell home.

207757.text: No, you're not. This thing is mine!

207758.text: We were the first to find it. And it's not like it has your name on it.

207759.text: Angling, Ruda, Calm down, both of you...

207760.text: Oh? It's you... Why didn't you let us know you were coming to the Kingdom of Lochaber?

207761.text: And not just that, you're trying to steal my seashell with a weirdo!

207763.text: The two explain the whole thing to Ruda. Ruda nods thoughtfully. It seems she has met this sea elf the two are describing.

207764.text: I think I've met this sea elf you described.

207765.text: You see, I need constant exposure to starlight in order to stay this pretty and fair-skinned. By luck, I found this place, a perfect spot to get starlight.

207766.text: When I first got here, I felt like there was a shadow skulking around all the time.

207767.text: I was so harassed by her presence. I couldn't absorb starlight in peace.

207768.text: One time, I caught her trying to steal this seashell. That's when I saw she was a shorty. She tripped while fleeing.

207770.text: ...Do you know where we can find her?

207771.text: She's not hard to find. I followed her when she fled. There's a big castle right past that forest. That's where she lives.

207772.text: Your friend might have been taken there.

207773.text: No time to waste. Let's go.

207774.text: Be careful on the road. She may look goofy, but I sensed strong power in her.

207776.text: How dare you call me short, you human vermin. I shall have you punished!

207777.text: Wait, what are they gibbering about now?

207778.text: Ha, they spilled the beans about that one. Ardisia can't know about this...

207779.text: Ugh... and they're laughing about it!

207780.text: What? They stalked me...? How despicable! Those humans... such a vile lot they are!

207781.text: No... I must not let them find my castle!

207782.text: This place is filled with the pungent smell of the sea... Do you know what that means?

207784.text: Angling swings the rod and the hook lands right in the sea monster leaping out.

207785.text: This place has become a paradise for the sea creatures, and that sea elf is likely to be nearby.

207786.text: Hahaha, shorty. Your friend is so funny.

207787.text: It's not nice to call someone a shorty...

207788.text: Hey, look out. Another horde of sea monsters!

207789.text: Have you noticed? The more I say the word "shorty," the more ferocious these sea monsters get.

207791.text: Yeah, Ardisia was most likely taken by that sea elf. We gotta hurry!

207793.text: Phew... Didn't know that guy could use traps. Cute.

207794.text: You're not afraid of them hurting you?

207795.text: Heh, relax. These monsters may look hostile, but the sea elves won't let them hurt humans.

207796.text: That is, if we don't attack the sea elves and their sea monsters first. It's part of the pact we made with their ancestors.

207797.text: There's a legend going around the village that whoever sees sea elves and hears them sing will receive Neptune's blessing.

207798.text: I think I've heard that legend before...

207799.text: Let's go save Ardisia and catch that sea elf!

207800.text: I think this is the place. Who would have thought there would be such a big castle out here? It's completely blocked by trees. No wonder no one can see it.

207802.text: Hehe, that's not gonna work. Sea elves either fear or loathe humans. You should call her "shorty" like Ruda does.

207803.text: A crab flies out of the castle.

207804.text: Tossing marine creatures will be met with punishment from the sea. Get out of here, little crab.

207805.text: You don't get to lecture me, human!

207806.text: Oh, it's you. The things you left behind, I've had one of the stall keepers put them away.

207807.text: S-Shut up! You don't get to lecture me either.

207808.text: Hmph, you may have found my secret base, but so what?

207809.text: Time to bring out the big guns!

207810.text: But... how is this even possible...?

207811.text: Hahah, save your strength. These sea monsters stand no chance against us. Surrender.

207812.text: Damn it, how did I lose to a piece of trash like that...?

207814.text: Let me tell you, you violated the rules of my game, and as a punishment I made Ardisia disappear!

207815.text: Wait... what? How could you hurt a human!? You broke the pact!

207816.text: Hahaha, now you know I'm not messing around!

207817.text: You hurt a human, and now I'm going to hurt you!

207819.text: A mere wall will not stop me!

207822.text: I'm okay. Damn it, I got tricked!

207824.text: You got what was coming to you!

207825.text: Angling, hang in there. I'm coming for you.

207826.text: Oh? Instead of fleeing, you entered my castle. How brave.

207828.text: I'm okay. Hurry and rescue Ardisia!

207830.text: Aw, how dare you threaten me...?

207831.text: You piece of human trash is not worthy of my time. Coral Wyrm, get her!

207832.text: W-What? My Coral Wyrm was defeated...?

207833.text: You'll have to do better than that.

207835.text: You think that's all I got...?

207836.text: Just outside Danelim's field of view, a barely visible fishing wire flies out of a pit and catches right on Danelim's skirt...

207838.text: You're going down, you smug elf!

207840.text: Ugh... filthy humans and their dirty tricks...

207841.text: Your game is over, sea elf.

207842.text: Now, be a good girl and hand over Ardisia. I know you didn't hurt her.

207843.text: Damn human, how dare you talk to me like that!

207844.text: This is not over. I challenge you to a duel!

207846.text: The Witch and Danelim start fighting in the open space in the castle. At this moment, the castle gate is silently pushed open, and out sneaks a petite figure.

207848.text: What are you doing here, Ardisia?

207849.text: I thought you had been captured by the sea elves?

207850.text: It's dangerous down there. Come up here!

207852.text: Hurry! The rope is slipping through my hands!

207854.text: Ardisia, I'm here. Hold my hand!

207856.text: In the heat of the moment, Danelim stops and rushes to save Ardisia. Before the Witch can redirect her magic projectile, it lands right on the castle behind Danelim...

207857.text: The powerful magic projectile lops a chunk off the top of the castle, revealing its interior...

207862.text: This is Captain of the FCO of the Kingdom of Lochaber, here under orders to investigate this place together with the knights of Burton. Open up!

207863.text: Knights of Burton, heed my command! Lock down this place!

207867.text: You humans are just so evil, bullying a helpless girl... Wahh!

207869.text: You, fill me in on what happened.

207871.text: Hmm... I see. Glad no one's hurt.

207872.text: But this sea elf is coming with us. We suspect she was involved in the sea monster attack on the market.

207873.text: Let go or I'll kick you!

207874.text: We will hand you over to the elven authorities, and you will be dealt with according to the elven law.

207876.text: Danelim is not a bad elf. Leave her alone!

207878.text: Hilda, I think there might be a misunderstanding.

207879.text: Misunderstanding? Only sea elves can control sea monsters—humans certainly can not. Even if she didn't give direct orders, she has something to do with the attack.

207880.text: Hilda, I was there. She helped us fight off the sea monsters.

207881.text: If you don't believe me, ask the stall keepers.

207882.text: Okay, I will look into this.

207883.text: Knights of Burton, heed my command! Return to the market!

207885.text: I will get to the bottom of this. If you are indeed culpable, I will come back for you.

207886.text: Hmph! Commanding sea monsters to attack worthless humans? That would be beneath the dignity of the noble Danelim.

207887.text: Verbal attacks on humans are also liable for punishment.

207890.text: Hilda, Danelim has no ill intentions. Just let it go.

207891.text: Alright, since you vouch for her, I'll pursue this no further. Farewell!

207893.text: I'm gonna tell Mom about this!

207895.text: Even if I don't tell her, she'll find out anyway.

207896.text: This castle was made of materials that only sea elves have access to. With a big chunk of it gone, it will take lots of those materials to repair it.

207897.text: Hmph. Sounds easy enough. I'll get the materials.

207898.text: But... back then you said you were going to build the most luxurious castle in the world, and you got a lot of rare materials from Mom.

207899.text: Well... even without those materials, my castle would still be the most luxurious one there is!

207900.text: But... without starlight, the castle would soon collapse into a pile of sand...

207903.text: Don't despair. I know someone who can help us repair the castle.

207905.text: If you tell me who that person is, I will start treating you as my equal.

207906.text: You know, it's not every day that a human earns respect from a noble elf.

207908.text: It's Ruda. She said she could fix the castle.

207909.text: I hear someone summoning me. Oh! It's my followers.

207910.text: Tell me, how can I be of assistance to you. I'm always generous to my followers.

207911.text: As you can see, we need your starlight to repair the castle.

207912.text: No problem, but I have two demands.

207913.text: As long as it's within my power.

207914.text: Don't worry. I will never put my followers in a tight spot.

207915.text: You over there, the girl who fishes. I like your grilled fish. I want you to cook me some.

207917.text: Good. Here's the other thing. You over there, the short one—

207918.text: Hey, watch who you call short!

207919.text: If that's your attitude, forget it.

207920.text: Come on, ma'am, please tell us your other demand.

207921.text: Well, aren't you a charmer? Wanna be my follower?

207922.text: I'd... rather not. Mom said not to go home with strangers...

207923.text: That's too bad. Alright, here's my second demand. Listen up, shorty, I need to borrow your castle.

207924.text: If you let me, I will forget everything that has happened and I will fix up your castle.

207925.text: What? You want me to give you my castle? Fat chance!

207926.text: Ouch, let go, Ardisia. It hurts... Alright, alright, I'll do it!

207927.text: Don't get me wrong. I have no ill intentions. I just think this is a better place for me to absorb starlight.

207928.text: Since you asked so nicely, I don't see why not...

207930.text: Hey, let's all go fishing together.

207932.text: No thanks! That kind of menial work is beneath me!

207933.text: If you don't pitch in, there will be no grilled fish for you. Didn't you say you wanted to try Angling's grilled fish?

207934.text: I know, but... I mean, unless someone...

207935.text: Danelim is the best. With Danelim's help, catching fish will be a breeze.

207936.text: Hmph, I knew you people couldn't do without me.

207937.text: Fine, since Ardisia sounded so sincere, I guess I'll help you...

207938.text: Alrighty! Let's go have some fun!

207939.text: Today was a fruitful day. Thank you, everyone!

207940.text: That's because you had someone like me as your partner.

207941.text: Come on, you barely lifted a finger...

207942.text: Well, I was saving my energy for more important tasks.

207943.text: A noble elf shouldn't bother with menial chores.

207944.text: Then you can forget about grilled fish tonight...

207945.text: You... vile human, how could you do that to me...!

207946.text: Go gut the fish. Consider it your chance to make amends.

207947.text: And now you're giving me orders? How dare you! You will regret this!

207948.text: Danelim, let me help you. Mom once taught me how to gut fish.

207949.text: The group laughs and chats as they prepare the seafood. By the time the sky turns red with sunset, Ruda has finished repairing the castle.

207950.text: Hahaha, here comes the grilled fish!

207952.text: Yep. Feels like something different has been added to the fish...

207953.text: Smells so nice. Here I go.

207954.text: Hold on! Give me the fish.

207956.text: This is it... This is the moment I've been planning for!

207957.text: The grilled fish is mine and mine alone! I'm gonna eat all of it. Hahaha!

207958.text: Only a noble elf like me deserves such a delicacy!

207960.text: Ugh, there she goes again... I thought sea elves were supposed to be nice and mild-mannered...

207961.text: Looks like she needs to be taught a lesson.

207962.text: Okay, guys, take the fish and distribute it among yourselves.

207964.text: Ah, she passed out. Is she gonna be okay?

207965.text: She'll be fine. I pulled my punches.

207966.text: Let's forget all that and start eating. The fish won't taste as good if it gets cold.

207967.text: Hmm! This grilled fish tastes as nice as starlight.

207968.text: If I could eat this every day, maybe my skin would get shinier.

207970.text: As everyone is savoring the delicious grilled fish, Ardisia secretly takes one serving and creeps up to Danelim.

207972.text: I just wanted to eat some grilled fish...

207973.text: Danelim, I'm here. Shh, look what I've brought you.

207975.text: You're the best, Ardisia! Unlike those vile humans. I hate humans!

207976.text: Don't say that. I'm human too.

207978.text: Actually, they're good people too. Go apologize to everyone when you finish, okay?

207980.text: Since you're awake, why don't you come sit with us? I saved some grilled fish for you.

207981.text: Yeah, come eat it before it gets cold.

207983.text: Aw, my bad for making too much grilled fish. Now I don't know what to do with it...

207984.text: Hmph, I knew you people would need my help.

207985.text: Fine, I'll take the high road and forgive you!

207986.text: Grilled fish, I'm coming for ya!

208001.text: Master, it's late. Get some sleep.

208004.text: The lights in the room dim. The Witch lies on her bed, looking out of the window at the stars.

208005.text: The stars are so beautiful tonight.

208007.text: As soon as she closes her eyes, the Witch feels her mind drifting into the void. Her voice and senses fade into silent nothingness in the midst of the stars...

208008.text: The void is growing tumultuous. The stars are starting to rearrange. Please, don't let anything happen at this critical moment.

208010.text: Huh... Why are there monsters in the mirror?

208012.text: How can this be...? N-No, I can't take on so many monsters by myself.

208013.text: Powerful stranger... Come help me, please...

208014.text: Grrrhhh... Don't even think about it...

208015.text: The Witch hears an unfamiliar call and slowly opens her eyes. What greets her is not the familiar sight of her room, but a silent sea of stars. Ahead of her is a small altar with a dim crystal orb sitting on top.

208016.text: Seven dark mirrors surround the altar. Standing before the altar is a strange girl with an anxious look on her face.

208018.text: Who are you? Why am I here?

208019.text: I'm Nannar, a descendant of the Void Clan...

208021.text: The monsters are coming out. I have to put myself to sleep, then release the forces and seal the Passage...

208023.text: The leftmost mirror suddenly glows blue. Two giant stone pillars emerge from it. One of them is half-collapsed and covered with hideous monsters. A petite young girl in white stands atop the pillar, struggling to dodge the monsters' attacks.

208026.text: How do I get into that mirror?

208027.text: You wanna do that? Don't bother. It's not gonna work. We'll have to figure out something else...

208028.text: No, I can save her. Just tell me how to get into that mirror.

208029.text: Well, if you insist. Take this crystal orb. It can open the Passage and stabilize the void seal...

208030.text: Nannar takes the crystal orb from the altar and hands it over to the Witch.

208032.text: Don't worry. You can count on me.

208035.text: You're back... And you really saved her.

208036.text: Those monsters are a real nuisance...

208037.text: The mirror and crystal orb have turned blue.

208038.text: Yep. When the monsters inside a mirror are defeated, the orb absorbs the force of that mirror...

208040.text: The seven mirrors represent the seven negative forces inside the human heart. Only when the orb absorbs them all will the seal becomes stable...

208041.text: I summoned you because I didn't know how else to avert the calamity...

208042.text: I'm sorry. I didn't know it would end up like this...

208043.text: Defeat the void monsters and seal the Passage. That's the only way you can go back.

208045.text: That's good to hear. I knew you had it in you!

208046.text: Now, the next mirror. It's cyan and represents the force of [Devour].

208047.text: It's so hot here. And there's magma everywhere...

208048.text: Not a single monster in sight? But I can feel magic energy in the air.

208050.text: You saved me, but still I want to devour your soul...

208051.text: Ah... Such a delicious soul. Must be rich in emotions...

208053.text: You're a void monster taking her form.

208054.text: The void gets its power from the darkness lodged in the recess of the human heart.

208055.text: The taller the building, the longer its shadow... And the shadow is what nourishes us—it will keep devouring light until we break the seal.

208056.text: The void, that's where everything will end up. So surrender...

208057.text: As "Metamorphoses" melts into a shadow and seeps into the ground, a swarm of hideous monsters emerges from a mess of magma and silhouettes. They glare at the Witch, saliva dripping from their mouths...

208060.text: The void shall never fail... Aargh!

208061.text: A huge explosion kicks up a storm of magma. In the nick of time, a small hand grabs the Witch by the shoulder and pulls her into the mirror behind her.

208064.text: You're... welcome. If it weren't for you, the calamity might have already happened...

208065.text: Ah, look. The mirror has turned cyan. And the crystal orb glows cyan, too.

208066.text: Does that mean I did it?

208067.text: Yes, you did it. I can feel the seal has become stronger...

208068.text: Five more to go. Keep it up.

208069.text: I've got some of my power back. I can help.

208070.text: No! You're human. If you keep getting back into these mirrors, your soul will be torn apart...

208071.text: Okay... (puts on a mask of puzzlement)

208072.text: Maybe I have a special constitution.

208073.text: No time for chitchat. Next, the mirror that represents the power of [Seduce]. The pink one.

208074.text: Master, you're awake. Did you sleep well last night?

208075.text: My head hurts... Is this... my room?

208076.text: Of course. You don't look so well. Bad dream last night?

208077.text: I suppose... I feel like I have forgotten something important.

208080.text: But what about the void...? Ugh, my head...

208081.text: Master, if you're not feeling well, rest some more. I'll go make you breakfast.

208082.text: This is my room, but why do I feel like I don't belong here?

208087.text: It's the crystal orb. The crystal orb!

208090.text: It's the force of Seduce. None of this is real.

208091.text: The surroundings shatter with a loud bang. A sharp pain rises from the depths of the soul...

208092.text: Ah, awake at last. I've been here waiting.

208094.text: Looks like you're not fully awake. Drink some water.

208095.text: With that, a kettle suddenly appears in Ella's right hand, fresh water bubbling out of it.

208096.text: I've been in a coma for centuries. During this time, there have been monsters coming around, drawn to my crystal orb.

208098.text: This is all an illusion created by the force of Seduce. I have to break it.

208099.text: Save your strength. I've been trapped here for thousands of years.

208100.text: Besides, I won't let you do it.

208102.text: Because in here, I don't have a care in the world. I can have whatever I want and do whatever I want.

208104.text: You humans and your hang-ups. I mean, I don't care if it's an illusion, as long as I get to stay carefree like this.

208105.text: But don't you get lonely being here all by yourself?

208106.text: That's why I'm trying to find a way to bring Nocturna and Metamorphoses here.

208107.text: In case you don't know who Nocturna and Metamorphoses are, they're my good friends.

208109.text: Come on, I'll take you to them.

208110.text: But I've practically turned this place upside down and still no sign of them.

208111.text: They're in the real world. We'll see them when we get back.

208112.text: Ha?! Save your strength. I've tried this countless times. There's no going back.

208113.text: Don't worry. This crystal orb will do the trick.

208114.text: Wait, what? Hey, let go of my tail!

208117.text: Even the force of Seduce couldn't trap you. I'm impressed...

208118.text: You seem to possess remarkable power. Who are you?

208119.text: Wah, the unlimited supply of snacks, the never-closing amusement park—it's all gone...

208120.text: (puts on a mask of joy) Ella, it's so great to see you again!

208121.text: Metamorphoses, why am I here? And where's Nocturna?

208122.text: (puts on a mask of sorrow) I haven't seen her since I got here...

208124.text: She must be inside one of the mirrors at the back...

208125.text: The void has been weakened again. She'll be fine.

208126.text: I can't wait any longer. I must save her!

208128.text: The crystal orb has been taken...

208129.text: She's inside one of the mirrors. Is there any other way you can send me in there?

208130.text: There is, but it's very dangerous.

208132.text: Okay, but remember, the path back can only be opened by the crystal orb.

208133.text: The next mirror is the force of the Intangible. The green one.

208134.text: Make sure to bring back the crystal orb...

208136.text: The monsters just keep coming. Where do I find Ella?

208137.text: Stranger, I'm impressed by your capabilities. Let's make a deal, shall we?

208138.text: Your voice sounds familiar. Who are you?

208139.text: I am the void. The void is me.

208140.text: If we are to make this deal happen, you need to tone down your hostility. I know what you want, and I know what you fear.

208141.text: But the void doesn't care. Your power is at odds with the rules of the void. In the grandness of the void, you are nothing but an infant.

208142.text: If so, why do you bother to make a deal with me?

208143.text: Well, as you can see, the void cannot interfere with the world of the living. That's a law of the universe, and no one is above it.

208144.text: But there's something I care about in the world. Something that needs to be done. That's where you come in.

208145.text: In exchange, I will track down your friends in the void.

208146.text: What exactly do you need me to do?

208147.text: Simple. Help Nannar reinforce the void seal.

208148.text: Come on, I'll take you someplace else. Your friends are not here.

208150.text: The void can do anything as long as it doesn't interfere with the world of the living—

208151.text: Be it create stars or devour time and space.

208152.text: It's troubling how powerful the void is.

208153.text: You said that before. And my response is still this: your view of the void is one-sided.

208155.text: You carry an aura of someone from the past. Time will give you answers.

208156.text: But for now, ready your weapon and prepare to fight, for twisted monsters are lurking close by.

208157.text: All these spatial and temporal warps are making me sick.

208158.text: Ah... thanks to you, I can finally show myself.

208159.text: Nannar? How is this even possible...?

208160.text: Don't get this wrong. I'm merely manifesting myself in a way that you can understand.

208163.text: Okay, how much do you know about the past?

208165.text: You don't know about that either...?

208166.text: Aw, turns out that girl is all talk and no action. Should've known she hadn't prepared anything!

208167.text: But then again, hahaha, the thought that she has become like this makes me wanna celebrate!

208168.text: Sorry, I honestly don't know what you're talking about...

208169.text: It's okay. Like you said, "time will witness everything."

208170.text: Go. Your friends are right ahead.

208171.text: I'm starving... Are you almost done, Ella?

208172.text: Yeah, I'll fix it up in no time! Piece of cake!

208173.text: Ugh, you said that a long time ago. I can't take the creatures here as servants. I'm so bored.

208174.text: Damn it, it was still functional when I got here. Why is it not working now?

208176.text: (squeaky sound) Trying to activate the crystal orb, of course...

208177.text: But biting it like that won't get you anywhere.

208178.text: Not one of those twisted monsters. Wonderful!

208179.text: Wow, what are you doing here?!

208180.text: She helped me find you guys.

208182.text: Hahaha, you got tricked. Time and space here are badly warped and prone to cause illusion.

208183.text: When I first got here, I even saw Ella had become my servant, pampering me and everything.

208184.text: What are you talking about? I would never do that.

208185.text: Well, that's why I said it was an illusion. Don't take it to heart.

208186.text: Illusion, huh... It's okay. Just give me the crystal orb, and I'll take you guys back.

208187.text: Those monsters are back. What a pain in the neck.

208188.text: Get out of the way. I'm going to show them the wrath of dragons!

208189.text: Haha... Now you have seen the might of dragons!

208190.text: Too bad I can't take them as servants. Combat like this is such a waste of time.

208191.text: The Passage is open. Let's go back.

208194.text: It's so good to see you guys back...

208195.text: But how did you come out through the other mirror?

208196.text: Tell me what happened back in there.

208198.text: Relax. I'm here. You have nothing to be afraid of.

208200.text: This place is empty as far as the eye can see. I miss the dessert of Muntenia so much!

208201.text: No, you can't leave just yet...

208202.text: Huh?! You took it upon yourself to summon me here, and now you forbid me to go home?

208203.text: No, that's not what I meant...

208204.text: Ella, take it easy. Let Nannar finish.

208205.text: Thanks. One more mirror to go...

208206.text: Until I take out all the void invaders, I can't wake up...

208207.text: And neither can I use my powers to send you on your way home...

208209.text: I know... but if we don't do it, we can't go home.

208210.text: Come on, let's go. Maybe we'll meet new servants.

208211.text: Not like we have a choice. Let's do this.

208212.text: That'd teach those weaklings my power!

208213.text: Not a single servant. What a waste of time...

208214.text: Nocturna, look! Is that a person over there?

208215.text: Wonderful. Let's hurry over. Could be a new servant waiting for us.

208216.text: That person has a strange aura about her. Be careful.

208217.text: Who are you people? How dare you not bow in my presence!?

208218.text: Ha!? You sure talk tough! Who are you?

208219.text: You don't even know me? You shall be punished in hell for your ignorance!

208220.text: ...That's a baffling conversion if I've ever heard one.

208221.text: Ha, looks like Ella has just found her kindred spirit. How about that!

208222.text: This one is not fit to be my servant. I'll let Ella have her.

208223.text: The nerve of you to disrespect me...

208224.text: You shall all be thrown to hell!

208225.text: Watch out. Those monsters are coming.

208226.text: Wow, she can control void monsters—could she be the culprit behind all this!?

208227.text: Perfect timing. I shall burn you all to a crisp!

208231.text: Ella, grab that crystal orb. She's about to turn into a monster!

208232.text: Don't tell me what to do. I've got this!

208236.text: We finally met an interesting human. If we let her perish like this, Ella would be devastated.

208238.text: One shall not cross the River of the Underworld until they have paid for their sins.

208240.text: She said she's gonna live 'cause she has unfinished business in this world.

208241.text: My head is killing me. What just happened...?

208242.text: You turned into a void monster. I saved you.

208243.text: Now that the crisis is over, would you like to be my servant? I find you quite likable.

208244.text: Oh no, Ella is sounding more and more like this winged girl...

208246.text: It's the other way around! She's copying the way I talk!

208248.text: Yes, we were teleported back here when you fainted.

208249.text: Ah, you're awake! How are you feeling?

208250.text: Slightly better, but still a little sick...

208251.text: You're much stronger than I imagined...

208252.text: I've never known anyone who stayed sane after crossing the void.

208253.text: So, has the crisis been averted?

208254.text: The seal has been restored, and we've come out of the mirror.

208255.text: That's right. I got you out of there.

208256.text: It's been a long day. We can finally go home.

208257.text: Hmph, knowing how spiteful you monsters are, I shall imprison you in the River of the Underworld for all eternity.

208258.text: Such beautiful stars. If only this was our world.

208259.text: The void births stars and creates space. Yet, it's a rather lonely place to be...

208261.text: N-Never mind. Forget I said anything! Thank you all for your help. I will send you back now...

208262.text: The girls turn into shooting stars and vanish into the night sky. Standing next to the mirror, Nannar appears lost in thought.

208263.text: The void is growing restless. The two of us can't keep it under control forever.

208264.text: Is she really who I think she is...?

208265.text: Not entirely. Not yet, anyway. But as promised, I have returned the lost item to its rightful owner.

208266.text: And now, we just have to wait for her return.

208269.text: Master, it's way past time to get up.

208270.text: I think I had a long dream...

208271.text: You look quite well. I suppose it was a good dream?

208272.text: Breakfast is ready, Master. Please go wash up.

208275.text: Thank you for taking care of me all this time.

208276.text: You sound like a different person.

208277.text: But still, I want to say this: You're welcome. I'm just doing what I'm supposed to.

208281.text: (sobbing) It's all the fault of the damned human, causing me to be scolded today......

208284.text: Stop. What's that you got there?

208287.text: Special grilled fish from the market! Just what my hungry stomach needed. Hmm! Delicious!

208290.text: Darn it. I went to a lot of trouble getting that grilled fish...

208291.text: Aren't mermaids supposed to have retreated from the world a long time ago? Where did you come from?

208293.text: Come on, it's just a grilled fish!

208294.text: It's highly unusual for a mermaid to show up here. I should bring her back to Ardisia and ask her about this.

208296.text: Wait, let go of me. Where are you taking me?

208298.text: Whoa, where did you come from? Gave me quite a scare!

208299.text: Let me tell you, those idiotic humans have no idea I'm using them. Now they're about to bring me that seashell I want.

208301.text: You're after that seashell, too, huh? A kindred spirit, I see!

208302.text: No... no, that seashell is my home...

208303.text: Ardisia is asleep. I think I should go home now...

208304.text: What? How can that be your home?

208305.text: I don't believe it. Come on, follow me!

208307.text: Uh... Will you let me go home now?

208308.text: No, not until I finish what I came here to do. For now, I need you to follow me!

208310.text: See? I'm not the only one who's taken an interest in that seashell. Those bad guys have their eyes on your home, too.

208311.text: You don't want to end up homeless, do you?

208313.text: Okay, okay, don't worry. I'll help you get your home back.

208314.text: But until then, I need you to stick close. Don't run off!

208315.text: Ardisia, it's dangerous over there. Come back!

208317.text: Ah! Why did the castle gate slam shut...?

208318.text: Umph... No, it won't open from inside...

208320.text: Wahhh... I never should have gotten curious about the outside world. If I had stayed home, that accident wouldn't have happened, and I wouldn't have gotten separated from my people, and then I wouldn't have come here and ended up trapped in a collapsed castle...

208321.text: I want to go home... I want to go back to the sea... Somebody help me, please...

208323.text: It was here a moment ago...

208326.text: Mmm. So delicious. I haven't eaten all day...

208331.text: Sorry. I thought you had left...

208332.text: D-Don't look at me! I may be the one who caught her... ahem, I mean, brought her here, but I didn't know she was in there when the castle collapsed.

208333.text: Wahhh, is there any grilled fish left?

208334.text: Hahaha, plenty. You can have however much you want.

208335.text: Have you guys seen Shiroi...? Oh, you're here.

208336.text: The castle has been repaired. I'm starving. Get me a grilled fish as well.

208337.text: Didn't know Ruda had a mermaid friend.

208338.text: Well, it's a funny story, actually. The other night, I was taking a starlight bath on the beach when I saw a sneaky shadow running out of the back door of a shop.

208339.text: At first I thought it was a thief, so I ran after her. When I caught up, I realized she was a mermaid. Well, a mermaid thief.

208340.text: Since I got separated from my people, I've never had enough to eat...

208341.text: In my defense, I repaid what I owed!

208342.text: Poor girl. Here, have one more. We've got plenty left.

208343.text: Oh, and that big seashell you people are making a fuss over—that's actually her home.

208344.text: She lets me use it to absorb starlight. In return, I bring her human food.

208345.text: Can't she return to her own kind?

208346.text: That'd be tricky. The mermaids went into seclusion ages ago. I barely ever see them.

208347.text: Besides, they have a rule that any mermaid who has come into contact with humans will be banished forever.

208349.text: I've heard Mom talk about the mermaids a few times, but that's it.

208350.text: Don't worry. I'll be sure to tell Mom everything that happened here.

208351.text: Ahem, Ardisia, when you do that, could you please not...

208354.text: Although... I might consider it if you let Shiroi move into the castle as well.

208355.text: My castle is pretty big. There's definitely room for one more person

208356.text: Alright, now that we're all here. Let the grilled fish party begin!

208358.text: Master, it's Halloween! Trick or treat, meow!

208361.text: Muntenia has a special candy for sale during Halloween.

208363.text: That's right. It's said that eating it makes you feel happy and content.

208364.text: Sounds amazing. It just so happens that I'm planning on visiting my friends in Muntenia.

208367.text: Master, you're not afraid of ghosts and stuff, right?

208368.text: If I meet one, I'll take care of it with a spell.

208370.text: Well, then I have nothing to worry about. Good luck.

208371.text: Time sure flies. It's getting dark already.

208372.text: There's a village ahead. We can stay there for the night.

208374.text: Excuse me, is there a hotel around here?

208375.text: Strange. So many new faces in town today.

208376.text: Then again, this is Muntenia. Strange things happen here.

208377.text: Do you mean there are other visitors besides us?

208378.text: You outsiders are too curious for your own good. It's dangerous to go snooping around at a time like this, you know!

208379.text: Hi there, if you don't mind, you can crash at my place.

208380.text: Hey, are you forgetting what day it is?

208382.text: Is there something going on around here?

208383.text: Nothing, really. Except sometimes strange things happen at night.

208384.text: But everything's fine as long as we keep our doors and windows shut.

208386.text: You can stay here for the night.

208388.text: I've been flying around all day. Let me get some sleep...

208390.text: Halloween is here, but Nocturna is nowhere to be seen.

208391.text: Ella was a little worried, so she made me come here with her.

208392.text: Oh, so you two know each other. That's good.

208397.text: Fine. Let's call it a night.

208404.text: Uh... Ella, what are you gibbering about...?

208405.text: Window? Oh, is that a monster lying on its stomach?

208406.text: Yes. One that I've never seen before. Ahhhh... I'm so sleepy. If there's nothing else, I'm going back to sleep.

208407.text: Wait, wait. That's one creepy monster!

208408.text: How are you guys not panicking right now?!

208409.text: Monsters are a common sight in Muntenia...

208410.text: Hold on, Ella. Are you afraid of... monsters?

208411.text: D-Don't be ridiculous! I'm an all-powerful dragon. A mere... monster doesn't bother me!

208412.text: That doesn't sound very convincing when you're shaking like that...

208413.text: I've had enough of this hellhole. I don't want to be here a second longer than necessary!

208415.text: It's getting foggy all of a sudden. Can't see a thing.

208417.text: Wow, Ella, you really channeled your fear.

208419.text: So what brought you here anyway?

208421.text: That candy you mentioned, Nocturna stocks up on them every year!

208424.text: Nocturna hasn't contacted us in a long time.

208425.text: We came here to look for her.

208427.text: We've been walking for a while now.

208428.text: Feels like we're going in circles.

208430.text: I read in a book about this kind of phenomenon. A certain kingdom calls it a "Ghost Barrier."

208432.text: Can't we break it using magic?

208433.text: Afraid not. According to the book, neither magic nor brute force can break the barrier.

208435.text: Calm down. Let me recall what the book says.

208439.text: Didn't know Ella had this side to her.

208440.text: Yep. Her house is filled to the brim with scared vessels from the Holy Church.

208441.text: Drop it, Metamorphoses! And... have you figured out how to get out of here yet?

208442.text: And she sleeps with lights on.

208443.text: Ahhh! I'm sick of this place!

208445.text: I hear a lot of screaming.

208446.text: That's to be expected. Those monsters fear sunlight and, by extension, flames.

208447.text: But we still can't get out—

208448.text: Ella, stop and look over there!

208449.text: Phew... That'll teach you to stay away from me, filthy monsters!

208450.text: Huh? Where did that headstone come from?

208451.text: Let's go have a look. Maybe it says something about how to get out of here.

208453.text: Let me see what's written on it—

208454.text: Pinch your nose with your left hand, put your right hand through your, then bend down and spin in place 30 times.

208455.text: Then jump like a frog 100 times while croaking like one.

208456.text: Lastly, stand on one foot for 1 minute?

208457.text: That's... seriously the way to get out of here?

208464.text: Look over there. A person with a golden glow is running toward us.

208465.text: And... chased by a horde of monsters!

208467.text: Thanks for your help. I owe you one.

208469.text: What a surprise. It must be destiny that we meet again.

208470.text: An evil dragon and... a strange human.

208471.text: For God's sake, why are you with those creatures?

208473.text: I just helped you defeat those monsters!

208474.text: Invaders of my homeland shall never be forgiven!

208475.text: A sinner is a sinner. And any threat to my homeland must be nipped in the bud.

208479.text: Are you going to fight me...?

208480.text: Don't do this, Catherine. There must be a misunderstanding.

208481.text: You see, we're trapped by these monsters as well.

208485.text: Fine, since you vouch for them, I'll give them the benefit of doubt.

208486.text: Besides, I don't have time to waste on you people anyway.

208487.text: My homeland is being harassed by unknown monsters. I'm here to hunt them down.

208488.text: Do you know how to get out of here?

208492.text: I am NOT. You're the one blocking my path!

208493.text: The monsters' aura has reached the castle atop the mountain. I'm heading there to check it out.

208494.text: The castle atop the mountain? That's Nocturna's home. We must hurry.

208496.text: Looks like you people have something to do with the monsters invading my homeland!

208497.text: Impossible. Nocturna would never do such a thing!

208498.text: Hmph, that's just what you think.

208499.text: You know what, since I'm going to visit Nocturna too, why don't we team up?

208501.text: Catherine, they're all my friends. You can trust them.

208502.text: If you say so, I guess I'll bear with them for now.

208503.text: But if any of you tries anything, I will not hesitate to unsheathe my sword!

208505.text: Is the war in the Kingdom of Celtica over?

208506.text: The internal strife has been put to rest, but the external threat is far from over.

208507.text: The Kingdom of Belgica is still on the prowl, waiting for the right moment to strike again. I can't let my guard down.

208508.text: Sounds like a tough job being the Miracle.

208509.text: I'm the hope of my homeland. I'm merely doing what's required of me.

208510.text: Ah, a fork in the road.

208511.text: Shall we cross the forest... or continue down the paved road?

208512.text: If you folks are Nocturna's friends, aren't you supposed to know which way to go?

208514.text: Nocturna would teleport us directly into the castle. We've never walked this road before.

208515.text: In that case, let's cross the forest. Seems faster that way.

208516.text: No, I'm not doing that. The forest creeps me out!

208517.text: Follow me down the paved road!

208518.text: An evil dragon scared of ghosts and monsters. What a laugh!

208522.text: Great minds think alike. Let's fight together!

208523.text: I'm just worried you might not be able to handle those monsters by yourself.

208524.text: I am the Miracle. I can handle anything. But thank you for your concern anyway.

208525.text: I thought you'd choose to travel with me. Your loss.

208526.text: Alright, since you've decided to split up, let's race to the peak of the mountain!

208529.text: Let's go. I'm already smelling the stink of monsters!

208530.text: She ran into the forest by herself. That's unexpected...

208531.text: Don't worry. Catherine can handle herself.

208532.text: It's just... I can't stop thinking about this whole Nocturna business...

208533.text: Well, since you're my friend, and Nocturna is friends with Metamorphoses, I might as well tell you the truth!

208534.text: Have you ever thought about why, as a vampire, Nocturna has no lust for blood?

208535.text: And she has a taste for apples...

208537.text: Nocturna lost her power in an accident. That's how she became the way she is.

208538.text: Nocturna told us a while ago that she would have her power back during the next lunar eclipse.

208540.text: Something must be going on here. There's a strange mood in the air.

208541.text: Are you talking about that woman holding an umbrella over there?

208542.text: Woman holding an umbrella? Hm... the aura is gone. There's only a bunch of monsters wandering around up ahead.

208545.text: That's some real magic right there!

208546.text: If only the homeland warriors could wield that kind of magic, perhaps the Kingdom of Belgica would no longer be a threat!

208548.text: Calm down, Ella. We lost those monsters!

208549.text: Looks like we all made it.

208550.text: We sure did. Those monsters fled in panic in my presence.

208552.text: Well, ghosts are pretty commonplace in Muntenia...

208553.text: I mean a real ghost! A woman holding an umbrella!

208554.text: There aren't any fake ghosts in Muntenia, are there?

208555.text: I didn't see that woman with my own eyes, but I felt her mood—gloomy, cold, lifeless.

208557.text: I didn't see any ghost lady holding an umbrella.

208559.text: Why can't you just trust me for once!?

208560.text: Alright, enough bickering. Since we're all here, let's keep moving!

208562.text: It's pitch dark inside. And the gate shows signs of damage.

208563.text: The woman with the umbrella—she's back again!

208564.text: Oh no, she's walking into the castle.

208567.text: You are not welcome here, intruders! Be gone!

208568.text: Nocturna? Why are you attacking me?

208569.text: I am a sworn servant of Her Ladyship. I owe her my life.

208570.text: And how dare you address her Ladyship by her name!

208572.text: The mood I detect is not that of Nocturna's.

208573.text: You have never seen her before? This is getting weirder and weirder.

208574.text: Nocturna never mentioned her. And no, we've never seen her in the castle before.

208575.text: Ha, the true culprit has finally shown up!

208576.text: I will make you pay for invading my homeland!

208577.text: Wait, wait, wait! Culprit? Invading your homeland? What are you talking about? Her Ladyship never mentioned any of this!

208578.text: S-She's coming at me! But Her Ladyship only charged me with getting help from the village to restore the light—

208581.text: Today I die for my homeland!

208583.text: There's only one person who can break this up—

208585.text: What a pain. Fine, I'll give it a try.

208586.text: Damn it, why did you stop me!?

208587.text: Accursed invaders, this is not over!

208588.text: Take it down a notch, all of you. This must be a misunderstanding.

208589.text: First of all, do you know where Nocturna is?

208590.text: Why would I reveal Her Ladyship's whereabouts to you people!?

208591.text: That's fine. We'll find her one way or another.

208592.text: W-What are you doing? Don't come any closer, or else!

208595.text: Step back. Let me handle this monster!

208597.text: How dare you carry me on your shoulder. Put me down!

208598.text: Sebastian, you scoundrel! There will be no Wacky Candy for you this Halloween!

208599.text: Look, that woman with the umbrella is talking to someone—

208600.text: The aura I detect is similar to Nocturna's, but slightly different...

208601.text: Let's go in and find out.

208603.text: Accursed intruders! You're all in on this together!

208604.text: This strip of cloth will shut you up.

208606.text: Let's go. That monster is trapped by my holy power for now.

208609.text: It's so dark in here. Not a trace of light.

208611.text: Now we can see where we're going.

208612.text: Do you guys know where we might find Nocturna?

208613.text: Don't ask me. I'm as clueless as you are. Nocturna's castle is a big place!

208614.text: I can feel the mood in the air, and it's being disrupted by something.

208617.text: What if she summons that monster back? I can't guarantee your safety.

208618.text: It's alright. Since it's something created by Nocturna, nobody will mind if I break it.

208619.text: Metamorphoses and I will just get more materials. Help her make a new one.

208623.text: Don't be scared, kid. I mean you no harm. Nocturna and I are good friends.

208624.text: Level with me! Did you summon the monsters invading the Kingdom of Celtica?

208625.text: We're just worried for Nocturna's safety. Just tell us the truth. We're not gonna hurt you, I promise.

208627.text: Who's making a racket in my castle?

208628.text: Oh, it's you folks. I'm in the middle of something right now. Do what you see fit!

208632.text: More monsters! They just keep coming!

208633.text: I knew it was you people. You summoned those twisted creatures to attack my homeland!

208634.text: Hold on. You're not from the Lethe?

208636.text: Not now! We've got a monster incoming!

208638.text: When Her Ladyship recovered her power, she accidentally tore a hole in the defense of the Lethe.

208639.text: That's why we're seeing so many twisted monsters in Muntenia.

208640.text: And there's this weirdo from the Lethe who's been giving Her Ladyship trouble…

208641.text: So that's why you thought we came from the Lethe?

208642.text: In my defense, though, the things you folks did doesn't exactly scream innocence!

208643.text: Breaking into someone's home, gagging them and tying them up, holding them in the corner to interrogate them!

208644.text: Now that you put it like that, yeah, it was a little out of line.

208646.text: World of Inertia, The Work of the Gods, and...

208648.text: No, it's not what you think!

208649.text: Ahem, these books are full of blasphemy. But as they say, you must know your enemy before can defeat them.

208650.text: Liar. Your heart is racing and your emotions are raging.

208652.text: I have a big library. Would you like a tour?

208653.text: What kind of blasphemous nonsense is that!?

208654.text: Huh? What I'm saying is, I have a lot more of these kinds of books. I can lend you some if you like.

208658.text: Her Ladyship is confronting that weirdo from the Lethe in the library right now…

208659.text: No time to waste. Let's go!

208660.text: She's suddenly become a different person!

208661.text: This is getting weirder by the minute...

208662.text: Well, you know, nothing is too weird in Muntenia. Am I right?

208663.text: Darn it. Can't open the library door!

208664.text: The library is bound by multiple layers of seals. You can't open this door by brute force.

208665.text: There's strong magic energy in the air. They must still be in there.

208666.text: Step aside. Let me try. Hah!

208668.text: Can't believe they sealed the door with magic. Outrageous!

208671.text: I don't care who you are. I'm not going to let you make a mess of my home.

208672.text: Looks like you still don't appreciate the gravity of the situation.

208674.text: Anyway, I'm not asking your permission. That evil dragon is already lurking in the castle.

208675.text: If I don't seal it away, not only this place, but the whole world will suffer.

208676.text: Let me repeat this, this is MY home! End of discussion.

208677.text: I don't care if some evil dragon will destroy the world. You will NOT go through my stuff!

208679.text: This person's magic... is much more powerful than Her Ladyship's.

208680.text: So this is the power of magic...? This is exactly what my homeland needs...

208681.text: Ahem, smashed the door with one hand.

208682.text: Ah, it's Nocturna... and a stranger.

208683.text: You sent for help...? No matter, I'm not backing down.

208686.text: Wait, the books scattered on the floor—I've never seen them before!

208692.text: Lord forgive my sins, but until then...
